name: Posada la Casita
description: Campground and hotel, with secure grounds, free taxi service into and out of town, mechanical pit to work on your car, mechanic available too if needed, restaurant, laundry service, swimming pool, travel agency. Hard to find but they also own Gekko Tours at airport, so if you visit there they can call and arrange for you to be shown the way.

name: Vereda del Lago Maracaibo
description: Very beautiful open Park beside Maracaibo Lake. Talked to the Police at the entrance ofthe Park and asked to stay there for one night. There's security all night. Very quiet.

name: Playa Grande, Choroní
description:
Talked to the Police at the entrance of the beach who let us stay for 2 nights for a "cooperation". We gave them BsF$300 (like USD$1) and next day the came to ask cooperation for the next shift! hahaha... ok, another BsF$300. The good thing is that the baeutiful beach is right there, not packed at all during week days and safe to swim.
There were toilets and showers beside us, but were closed. probably open on weekends. There are also a few restaurants but didn´t have toilets.

name: Jorge's Parking Lot
description:
It's a house with a big parking lot. They have 2 dogs so watch out when walking through... poooooop everywhere!
They charged BsF$300 for the night and let us use the bathroom and "outside shower" (a hose)

name: Bomberos Universitarios San Juan de los Morros
description: Not a fancy place but just enough to stay one night on our way to Los Llanos. Very friendly people.

name: PuertoGas C.A.
description:
The most inexpensive propane EVER!
You need to leave your cillinder and pick it up after 2pm and pay BsF$30 (around 10 US cents) OR what we did, pay BsF$50 (for a 20 lbs) , refill it in the same minute and take it with you...
We were so happy that gave some tip for the guy that refilled it...

name: PDV Parking Lot besiade Firemen
description:
We talked to the Firemen that were around for a safe place to park and as their Station was not built yet, they allowed us to park at the PDV parking lot beside their temporary Station.
Very nice people, they helped us with a mechanic issue and let us stay for 2 nights.

name: Hato El Cedral
description:
A place that everyone should visit, it's just amazing!
Came for a full day tour (kind of Safari) and paid BsF$1700 (around US$6) including lunch (Bbq on a stick, rice and vegetables) and dinner (baked chicken, rice and salad)!!!
I recommend it 100%.
After dinner we asked to stay overnight in the parking lot to avoid driving in the night and they accepted.

name: Salto Catedral
description: July 2015 we paid 500 Bolivares to camp on a lovely spot overlooking the rolling hills next to a wash basin.

name: Roraima Viewpoint
description: This is the 5th time we camp here on our way through the Gran Sabana. Our favorite spot that is easy accessible from the main road. Perfect quiet with a view of the "Tepuis" to die for. Free.

name: Salto Yuruani
description: Free place to stay on both sides of the river near the waterfall. Perfect place to chill and bath in the river. Note however that during the rain season many "jejennes" or little biting flies favor this locating as well. High clearance vehicle strongly recommend. South side of the river needs 4x4 to get to the camp. But has toilets and more shaded straw thatched huts.

name: Iboribó / Aponwao
description: Paid 100 Bolivares per night to camp right on the side of the river. From here a guide can take you either in a boat trip or a nice Savanna hike to the base of the impressive waterfall nearby.

name: Kauai-Merú
description: Lovely rugged 4x4 drive to get here. You will need a high clearance vehicle with low range 4x4! The place was empty but can get crowded during local holidays. e.g. Christmas and January. The river camp has thatched indigenous huts and a new toilet facilities have been built. We gave a small donation to the care taking Pemón. From Kavanayén it's only 20kms or so, but can take you a few hours.

name: El Abismo
description: During off season we could camp for free at Andrés his nice place. Gets crowded during local holidays (Christmas and January). From here there is excellent hiking to various viewpoints of the plains in Brazil and the steep drop-off called "El Abismo".

name: Victor's Place
description: We could camp and park the car for a few days while touring the Orinoco Delta to the Orinoco Eco Camp. Talk to Victor or Hani (owner of the Orinoco Eco Camp). www.orinoco.eco.camp.com

name: Airport Maturin
description: 20 Bolivares per night on the quiet parking of the airport. You could leave your vehicle for a few days as well if your flying to Trinidad and Tobago. We couldn't find a flight within the next few weeks...

name: Cueva Del Guácharo
description: I  think it was 15 Bolivares per person to camp on the guarded parking lot in the forest. Spectacular cave visit should not be missed.

name: Playa Puy Puy
description: Free camping on the beach. Under the coconut palm trees. We struck luck in seeing the last batch of turtles hatch and make a beeline for the sea. Note that weekends can get noisy with beach campers that bring generators and music.

name: Encanto De Cuyuni
description: Swiss owner Bruno has built a strange camp on the river bank. Stayed here 2 times and all the time prices fluctuated. First time we paid 600 Bolivares per person. It is a safe place although it is in the middle of contraband region. Bruno is a interesting figure who loves to play Swiss traditional jodel music loud on Sunday morning!

name: 3D Equipamento
description: Gabriel has a nice small workshop for heavy suspension and frame modifications. Plasma cutting and a small powder coating setup.

name: La Conserva
description: This is a quiet little sandy spot with crystal clear water. Tropical colored fish right in front of it near the rock outcrop. Fisherman use this spot to reel in the nets. Sandra and Cubano live above it and you need to ask permission to camp. They'll show you the hidden water tap. Warmest greetings from us: Karin-Marijke and Coen.

name: Hotel Anaconda
description:
Good free parking, secure, wifi

Buen parking gratis, seguro, wifi

name: Posada La Huerfana
description: This is an awesome place, beautiful surrounded by mountains. You will have time to unwind and explore. you can fish, hike, sleep under the stars It gets chilly at night! you will be cooked by the owners they are great people. We have stayed in this place and it's an amazing experience.

name: Balneario Karukuy Meru
description:
Nice place with straw thached huts, tables, benches and  fireplaces as well as a natural pool for swimming near Santa Elenas Airport.
Indigenas come here to wash clothes, seems to be crowded on weekends.

name: Villa nela
description:
Hotel, near the route, parking with security without height limit. 4000sf double room. 

hotel,cerca de la ruta, estacionamiento con seguridad sin límite de altura. 4000bsf habitación doble.

name: De San Diego
description: nd there is plenty of room and levelled parking. The staff is very friendly. If you use the gas stove in the kitchen they charge 3000 pesos an hour. They also offer tours here. 7500 pp for camping

name: Kamoiran Hotel/Fuel Station/Campground
description:
This is the last petrol station before the Brazilian border where petrol is being sold officially to non-locals. Shortages and queues are common. Fill up as soon as you get there (or you might have to wait). Nice restaurant and swimming hole in river behind the house on the spot, you can camp in the parking lot or (like I did) just a kilometre further south off the highway.

Wifi, Restaurant, Hotel, Camp Ground, and a waterfall at the Back.

name: Posada Los Pinos (camping in yard)
description:
In the nice but rather tiny yard of Posada Los Pinos. Parked on the lawn across from the parking (on the parking itself it’s not so great, but possible). Safe, quiet at night, small, fresh pool with little slide for kids, clean cold showers and bathrooms, very good dinner at restaurant (around USD 7), fast wifi, water, electricity. 20min walk from town centre. German owner Eric has his own travel agency organising Roraima trips (around USD 200/five days) on which I ended up with a crappy rented sleeping bag. I stayed there for weeks when I was ill and was very glad to have a peaceful, quiet safe haven. Paid around USD 4/night.
Big rigs: Erm... that depends on how much space there is when you show up. I'd say it's not ideal.
Tents: Should be no problem, but I'd say it's not ideal.

name: Altos hostal
description: ur oto run (if you want it) and Bolivar will show you archeological places and explain everything. Half day to 3 days (paramo de la magdalena) rides and many options (with or

name: DIAN (Customs)
description: Place to come if you need to extend your temporary importation permit. We were given 90 days but spent 30 days in Venezuela (crossed through Cucuta), leaving the vehicle in Colombia. They needed to verify the original importation permit issued in Santa Marta, so tons of phone calls back and forth. If you have questions about the process, feel free to contact us via bkexplore (Instagram or Facebook)

name: PN Sierra Nevada Mucubaji
description:
Very nice place in the andes and you can find hiking trails especial  the way to the Laguna Negra.
Electricity from the restroom near the restaurant.

name: campobasso
description:
This is a good stop for one night, espacely before you go to the high andes. 
Very friendly and for free.

name: Jardin Ecológico Topotepuy
description: $1 entrance fee- gorgeous views of Caracas, better come during the week to avoid the crowds, knowledgeable staff . Worth it.

name: Aldea 6km después de Salto Kama
description:
Indigenous village where talking with the leader is possible to allow you to camp in some craft shops under construction, also rent rooms.
---
Aldea indígena donde hablando con el capitán es posible que te permitan acampar en unos locales de artesanías en construcción, también alquilan habitaciones.

name: CCCT
description:
This is a large highly recognizable mall in the middle of Caracas.  Parking Inside on street level you can park larger SUVs and overland vehicles.  You may not be able to park RVs.  

The mall has all major banks, good places to eat, and a hotel and its a good place in ccs to set up a rendez-vous with locals.

name: playa sipara
description: This is a very wild camping, you can place the tent around cocunut trees and water you can take it from a near river, there are two places on the river one for women and one for mens, and you could be a locky person if some big turtle come to place eggs on the sand

name: Hotel Andrea
description: Good hotel on the side of the main road accross the street from the gas station. Secure parking in the back without height limit. Paid about $1 US (500k Bs) at the DolarToday non official rate. For 2 people is 600k Bs, not much more...

name: La Perla Hotel
description: Basic, clean, A/C with gated parking. Cost us 300 Bolivares soberanos which today equal 3 dollars for a Double Room.

name: Buzos Place - dive center
description: Diving Center / kayak tours. Excellent spot. Amazing service and fair price. Paid 5 USD for a full day tour. William, the guide very knowledgeable and flexible.

name: Cristina Hotel
description: We searched quite a while until we found this, which seemed to be the best value. Internet works at reception and gated garage. The quality is not that great but cold shower and clean sheets were all we really looked for. Paid 5million which today equal 20 reais for a Double room.

name: Quebrada Pacheco
description: Big Parking Lot with shade, bathrooms and close to two falls. Quiet night, very cool spot and across the river you can hike to see the tepuyes.

name: Cabañas Friedenau
description:
Really nice compound with a variety of rooms available for small or larger groups. Also overlander friendly. Luis and Marielvis, the owners, can help you with information about the area and get you in touch with guides for Roraima treks. Good restaurant in the property. Recommended! Prices vary depending on the type/size of room or accommodation.

2023: We paid 10$ per night for two persons, a dog and a Landcruiser. I think it's 10$ per car.

name: Cabañas Friedenau Hotel
description: Really nice compound with a variety of rooms available for small or larger groups. Also overlander friendly. Luis and Marielvis, the owners, can help you with information about the area and get you in touch with guides for Roraima treks. Good restaurant on the property. Recommended! Prices vary depending on the type/size of room or accommodation.

name: Salto Kae Wild Camping
description: Wild camping spot above Salto Kae, a magnificent waterfall, deep in the Gran Sabana. The route here is a technical off-road route. Deep ruts, river crossings, 70+ degrees up and down hills. You will require winch, high clearance, traction boards and it’s highly recommended you do it with at least another vehicle. You’ll require to download GPS way points to be able to navigate and get to this place. Preferably do it with someone local who knows the area to be able to find the route. One of the most spectacular routes and places in Venezuela.

name: Salto Kae
description: Salto Kae, a magnificent waterfall, deep in the Gran Sabana. The route here is a technical off-road route. Deep ruts, river crossings, 70+ degrees up and down hills. You will require winch, high clearance, traction boards and it’s highly recommended you do it with at least another vehicle. You’ll require to download GPS way points to be able to navigate and get to this place. Preferably do it with someone local who knows the area to be able to find the route. One of the most spectacular routes and places in Venezuela.

name: Campamento Serrania
description: Campamento Serrania Camping and Adventure. You’ll need to reserve camping or cabins in advance by sending a WhatsApp message to +58424025108 (Zanmy). This is your one stop for adventure! Canyoning, mountain biking, rafting, trekking, pendulum, etc. Amazing views of the Venezuelan Andes. Prices per person in USD: $15 camping, $20 for tent rentals and $25 for cabins. Prices include all meals super generous and tasty food! Big rigs fit but there’s a hanging bridge with a 5 ton max capacity.

name: Aduana (SENIAT) - Vehicle TIP
description:
Once you get your entry stamp on your passport you need to come here and provide the aduanas agent (Antonio) with your vehicle’s title and passport. They will grant you a TIP for the same amount of days you were given on your passport. The process can be unnecessarily bureaucratic.

The Aduanas office works from Monday to Friday from 9 AM to 3 PM. Plan accordingly.

name: Taller Mecanico J.C « Los Amigos »
description:
Juan Carlos is a Very nice mecanic guy, patient profesional and at a good price !
He loves overlander and travelling with and his big motorhme ford 250.
He really can do everything mecanic for all type of car. 
He knows perfectly other trust people for electric or other parts.
Really highly recomanded
number wasapp +543874045873
adress pasage anta 1443

name: Policia Estadual
description: Safe Stop. Parada segura ..Policia..Estadual...,................,......

name: Brisas Kawi
description:
Basic camping. without electricity, waterfall,  and well. 
-----
sem energia elétrica..tem cachoeira, poço.  Indigina

name: Caribbean Beach
description: No beach unfortunately but a decent, secure, quiet Motel style place in El Tigre.  WiFi is limited to rooms near office.  supermarket 2mins drive.

name: Hotel Vistavila Suites
description: Nice hotel 10 mins walk from University area. Decent double room 10usd.  Secure underground free parking. Shopping street 5mins walk, supermarket across the street.

name: Hotel Cacique
description: Very nice rooms, chalet style, in secure gated compound.  restaurant, swimming pool.  McDonald's, burger king, gas station and small supermarket across the street.  10usd.

name: Hotel Madrid
description: Decent basic hotel near the main square.  Lots of cafes, restaurants, tour guides nearby.   plenty of gated secure parking.  3usd....but recommend staying in the mountains before Merida if possible, lots of beautiful small towns with hotels.

name: Santo Domingo - Roadside
description: Beautiful winding mountain road, could do with some maintenance in places, but passes numerous pretty towns with hotels, lakes, waterfalls, small castles, stone churches... thoroughly recommend.

name: Parador Turistico Puerto Concha
description: House on the water where you can pitch a tent or hammock for free and watch the Catatumbo lightning.  It's also used as a police guard house so there's 2 friendly policeman sleeping there also.  I was unlucky with the weather/lightning though.   Has electricity points, kitchen, toilets and showers. can swim in the lake.  need to rent a boat to get there though I paid 40usd return.  take repellant, lots of biting insects.

name: Mirador Chenguilo
description: This is a spectacular view point into Magdalena Canyon and to the  waterfalls coming down from the mountain!

name: Max Home. I help travellers.
description:
Max is a great person who Ioves help travellers from all the world. You can contact him on WhatsApp: +584148939989, or Instagram is @max.4x4
He will give you all the information about the Gran Sabana, and also mechanic assistance.

name: Motorhome aside the road
description: Lovely and humble venzuelan couple, living inside an RV. Wiliana and Ronald. Wonderfull persons, don't hestitate on park here. They will help you in everthing, there is place for one vehicle. Safe. We spent one night with them.

name: Cuyagua Beach
description: Excelent place to wild camping in this clean and little beach. Lovely neighboors. We ask if we could put our tent in the sand and they said it was safe. No facilities, but there is a little restaurant nearby. No phone reception

name: Cobalongo
description:
Ample camping spaces. Electric light and water. Shopping place for food and drinks. Safe area.
---
amplio espacios para acampar. luz electrica y agua. lugar de compras de comida y bebidas. Area segura.

name: Playa Cuyagua
description: Beautiful beach with huge space for camping, surfing, activities... It has a river at the side, little restaurants and small hostels in town.

name: Chaguarama
description: Beautiful lonely beach with big space for camping

name: Playa Cuyagua
description:
Beach for surf fans and outdoor camping.  Safe site, food and phone signal services
...........
Playa para los fanaticos de surf y de la acampada al aire libre.  Sitio seguro  .servicios de comida y señal telefonica

name: Campamento Chivaton
description: 17 Cabins in the middle of Gran Sabana, access on 4x4 or hi clearance only, they have restaurant, water from a small river and generator, you can overnight on the parking lot, with a small fee, very friendly Family, ask for Maria or Leonardo

name: Laguna de Canaim
description: Laguna de Canaima at Canaima National Park, you can only fly from Puerto Ordaz, no roads, here is the airport, and many hostals, hotels and resorts, right there is the Salto Golondrina Water Fall, and Salto El Sapo Water Fall, from there you can book a Angel Fall tour, 4 hours on a motor boat, then 1 hour hiking to the base of the water fall, there is a full day tour or a 2 days tours, overnight on a hammok camp in front of the Angel Fall, not a cheap destination, installing tent are not allowed, you must book a all inclusive tour from Puerto Ordaz or Ciudad Bolivar, 3 days tour is from $350 to $500 dollars per person. There are special trekking tour to the top of the Angel Fall (7 days)

name: Free Camping Spot in Kavanayen
description: Very close to the Kavanayen Indian Community, there is a small forest were you can overnight, they have public toilets (working on and off) and very close to the main Plaza, Kavanayen Monasterium and Restaurant Guadalupe (very recommended), also grocery store (may be expensive)

name: Paraitepuy
description: Start of the Roraima Trekking! An Indian Community, 20 km offroad from the Main Road Troncal 10, 4x4 only! steeps and narrow roads, you can book a jeep transfer from San Francisco de Yuruani (by the main road)

name: La Playita Campsite
description: Campside at the river, white sand beach, clean water, very bad road (4x4 only) if you find the gate closed, you have to open it and close it again, there is some cattle around, very quiet, but a lot of mosquitos (puri puri) during the day, specially bad at sunset, then they disappear, very nice views after a short hike up the mountain

name: La playita
description:
Very good point. Warm waters and sandy beaches.
---
Muy buen point. Aguas calidas y playas de arena.

name: Campamento aleman
description: Fantastic camp to rest and connect with nature

name: Cinaruco
description: River of fresh water. very good fishing and good camping

name: Bugparadise
description: Stop in Casa Maria at the entrance of the main road, if you want to camp here. It's a place destinated to bird, butterflies and nature watching

name: New Point - Cuyagua
description:
Place to relax and rest and enjoy the best beach in the country
.
Lugar para relajarse, descansar  y disfrutar de la mejor playa del país.

name: Campamento del piloto
description:
Fishing camping cinaruco river fishing camp on the cinaruco river
---
Fishing camping cinaruco river campamento de pesca en el rio cinaruco

name: Playa castilletes zulia
description:
Virgin beach. Good breeze and excellent point. place where Venezuela was born
---
Playa virgen. Buena brisa y exelente punto. Lugar donde nace venezuela

name: Salto chivaton
description:
Beautiful waterfall and outdoor camping. Good weather and good service. Located in the beautiful great Venezuelan savannah. Only access in moderately modified 4x4 vehicles.
---
Hermosa cascada y campamento al aire libre. Buen clima y buena atención. Ubicada en la hermosa gran sabana venezolana. Solo acceso en vehiculos 4x4 medianamente modificados.

name: Playa mañoco
description:
Sandy beach on the banks of the Cinaruco River. Good fishing.
---
Playa de arena a orillas del rio cinaruco.  Buena pesca.

name: Salto chirimata mileniun
description:
Natural waterfall within the valley of the Arabopo River. Near the wei tepui and tepui roraima
---
Casacada natural dentro del valle del rio arabopo. Al laso del wei tepui y tepui roraima

name: Salto morok meru
description:
Imposing waterfall of pure and crystalline water. Cold breeze. Good place for camping.
---
Imponente casacada de agua pura y cristalina   Brisa fria  .buen lugar para campamento.

name: Donde Guadalupe
description:
The best place for eating Venezuelan typical/indigenous food. Ask for Guadalupe in the boulevard and she will happily serve you.
Ask for the Tuma.

20/25 pp

El mejor lugar para comer comida típica/indígena venezolana. Pregunta por Guadalupe en el boulevard y con gusto te atenderá. Pregunta por la Tuma. 

20/25 pp

name: Hotel pellegrino
description: Good hotel to spend the night on the trip to the Gran Sabana   Pet friendly

name: La playita
description: Good spot for camping ,cold wather an white sand

name: Aguas calientes
description: Good place to camp, good temperature water

name: Anauaic
description:
Good place for camping.
—-
Cadena de saltos con buen campamento para acampar

name: Flamingo Lodge
description:
Family with a house in the country. Camping and river and good vibes.
Contact +58-412-4069728

name: Donde martin
description:
Translation: Camp on the shore of the tasting bay. Excellent to spend the day

Campamento a orilla de la bahia de cata. Exeelente para pasar el dia

name: Restaurante
description:
After the Simamaica tollbooth on the left, barely 1 km away there is a restaurant and a naval guard post.
They kindly let us spend the night.
large parking
---
Pasado el peaje de Simamaica a mano izquierda, a apenas 1 km hay un restaurante y en puesto de la guardia naval.
Muy amablemente nos dejaron pasar la noche.
Gran parquing

name: Puerto Escondido
description:
We visited Coro, for being World Heritage since 1993, by UNESCO.
But the Paraguaná peninsula and its road to the Cabo San Ramón Lighthouse made us fall in love.
We decided to spend the night in an area close to a restaurant, in Puerto Escondido. Perfect
---
Visitamos Coro, por ser Patrimonio Mundial desde 1993, por la UNESCO.
Pero la península Paraguaná y su carretera hacia el Faro Cabo San Ramón, nos enamoró.
Decidimos pernoctar en una zona cercana a un restaurante, en Puerto Escondido. Perfecto

name: Agua Salobre
description:
Pier to visit the Morrocoy National Park.
Recommended Cayo Sombrero $80 per boat one way 8, 9 or 10 h
  / return 16 or 17 h. Capacity 8 or 9 people.
Another key "Playuela or Playuelita", also recommendable.
Great parking for overnight, any vehicle and very safe and quiet.

Embarcadero para visitar los cayos del Parque Nacional de Morrocoy.
Recomendable cayo Sombrero 80$ por barca ida 8, 9 o 10 h
 /vuelta 16 o 17 h. Capacidad 8 o 9 personas.
Otro cayo "Playuela o Playuelita", también recomendable.
Gran pàrquing para pernocta, cualquier vehiculo y muy seguro y tranquilo.

name: SENAIT and GUARDIA NACIONAL BOLIVARIANA
description:
stop here to do the papers to get in Venezuela with a foreign vehicle. look for Carlos in SENIAT. He's a very gentle man.
than Salomón from La Guardia Nacional will give another pink paper.

name: Cienaga lodge
description:
Unique paradisiacal beaches in Venezuela 
Comfortable house with capacity for 12 pax. 

Playas paradisiacas unicas en venezuela 
confortable casa con capacidad para 12 pax.

name: PDV SA - Lecheria
description:
good gas station to stop by, fill the tank, grabbing some food, exchange oil.. nice people here. 
there's no Diesel available.
try the pizza place right in front!!!

name: Café Savignano
description:
Best Place for chill. Nice coffee and meal
Excelente lugar para un buen café y relajarse. La comida es simple pero muy sabrosa.

name: Salto Kama Meru
description:
Beautiful place to spend a day or more...
they also have room to rent.
there's a huge waterfall 70m.
and a river to swim .
carry your own things to do some barbecue 
They will make you a meal for $6 USD

name: Rapidos Anaiwan
description: Beaitiful river to swim. Anything else. Small spot to place a tent. Difficult road to acces, sometimes sandy.

name: Kapui tours
description:
Very beautiful campsite next to the Puente del Lago, the second longest in Latin America with 8,630mtrs. It has a very nice view and David is very attentive and friendly, you can kayak to navigate the lake

Camping muy hermoso al costado del Puente del Lago, el segundo más largo de América Latina con 8.630mtrs. tiene vista muy bonita y David es muy atento y amigable, se puede hacer kayak para navegar el lago

name: Piedra de la Virgen
description: Perfect spot to overnight with tent or motorhome. Plenty of drinkable water, toilets, bucket shower, wifi and amazing staff. The only negative thing it's the sound of the generator (5h-21h). No mosquitoes, no sandflies.

name: Comunidad Apanao
description: Friendly comunity! They let us camp under a rooff. Safe place to overnight.

name: At the school
description: Closed school. The police in front let us camp under their protection. Friendly people just for one night.

name: Next to the Alcabala
description: Friendly staff. They allowed us to camp next to the "alcabala". They invited us a massive watermelon, water and lunch!!

name: Next to the Alcabala
description: We asked the "alcabala" to camp next to them. They allowed us and invite some potable water. They let us take a shower!

name: Las Gardenas
description: Small and quiet village. You can camp next to the Orinoco river. Sandy road mostly in good conditions, at least in dry conditions. Accesible for any kind of car.

name: Proteccion Civil Anzoategui
description: Proteccion Civil and Firemen. Friendly people, 24h running place. They let us take a shower, fill the bottles even cook intheir kitchen!! We also camp!

name: Alcabala Guarapera
description: Safe area to sleep. Has a 24h "alcabala". We ask in a restaurant to sleep under their roof and they allowed us!

name: Isla la Plata
description: Nice small island. Small white sand beach, clear water, great place to practice snorkel. 3$ to cross (go and back) from Pamatacualito. Some rubish from the locals but mostly clean. Has people during the week provably crowdy the weekend! Has restaurant but better to bring everything with you. Mostly no shadow, just the umbrellas from the restaurant.

name: Next to the "alcabala"
description: Safe place, next to the "alcabala", nothing special, no facilities, not beautiful, just safe! They let us camp. Plenty of space for motorhomes.

name: Parque Nacional Mochima
description:
National Park Mochima. 
- Nearest beaches 40$ (6pax)  Far away beaches 55$ (6pax) Go and back: They leave you at one beach of your choice, and then they pick you at 17:00 latest.
- Tour 12 beaches 120$ (6pax) tour 6 beaches 80$ (6pax)
Super expensive, we didn't go...

name: Ferry Margarita
description: Ferry to Punta Piedras 14$ + 2$(bicycle)

name: El Horcón
description: Fisherman village. Camp next to the chapel. We ask the fishermen and they said OK. Safe place! Looks like there is a community tap but we didn't ask for water. Not the best beach, plenty of boats.

name: Punta Arenas
description: Beatiful beach!! Awesome sunset! there are two restaurants, apparently they open the weekends. We camp under the roof of one! no shadow except for the roof and other stuff from the restaurants. Toilets available, no water.

name: Playa el Tunal
description: Beautiful wild beach. Has a palm roof. Quiet place. Easy road to access.

name: Ferry Margarita - La Guaira
description:
The company Paraguana makes the trip on Wednesday at 21h from Margarita to La Guaira. 31$ the cheapest, then 51$ & 81$. 10 hours
We bring our bicycles 10$ each!
Super freezing, bring as much clothes as you can!

name: Playa Cangrejo - Centro de Protecion Civil Urbaneja
description:
Official support center for travelers in the Municipality of Lecheria. Very safe place, facing the sea and the building offered internet, bathrooms and water. All the staff are very receptive and treat you in the best possible way. We felt completely comfortable here. Nearby there are several restaurants and fast food.
.....
Centro oficial de atención al viajero en el Municipio de Lechería. Lugar muy seguro, frente al mar y el edificio ofrece internet, baños y agua. Todo el personal es muy receptivo y te trata de la mejor manera posible. Nos sentimos completamente cómodos aquí. Cerca hay varios restaurantes y comida rápida.
.....
Centro oficial de apoio aos viajantes no Município de Lecheria. Lugar muito seguro, frente ao mar e o prédio oferece internet, banheiros e água. Todo o pessoal é muito receptivo e te tratam da melhor forma possível. Nos sentimos completamente confortáveis aqui. Próximo tem vários restaurantes e comidas rápidas.

name: Venezuela Entry
description: Quick procedure. Asked for maximum and got 90 days. However they don’t write the 90 down with the stamp like in other countries but confirmed it to me twice that it is correctly in their system. SENIAT (Vehicle entry) is not possible here they sent us to San Antonio de Táchira which is 6km away and which is exactly the boarder we were denied before.

name: Venezuela Vehicle Permit SENIAT-Aduana Primaria
description:
It may be possible to cross with a motorcycle here but definitely not with a car. Colombia Dian will send you to the other border post.

Anyhow the other border post is much quieter and more pleasant.

name: R.C.V. + Medical. Certificate
description: Here we found a place where we bought the med cert and vehicle insurance.

name: Movistar
description: Place to buy a telephone chip. Yes also as a foreigner you’ll get your chip here.

name: R.C.V.
description: Another place to buy the vehicle insurance requested by SENIAT. Very friendly woman who sold us the annual insurance per moto for 25.000 Colombian Pesos. We also got the necessary copies here for the SENIAT procedure.

name: Hotel Centro Internacional
description: Hotel with secure parking. Basic but clean and friendly staff. 12$ for a matrimonial. No breakfast. Just in case you need to stay in San Antonio for the night.

name: Rapidos de Kaimoran Gas station, restaurant, hotel
description:
Parking of a hotel where you can overnight on your rig, there is also a gas station (no diesel) and restaurant. To visit the Kaimoran Rapids is free.

Parking de un hotel donde se puede pernoctar también hay una estación de servicio de gasolina a1$us por litro y restaurant, Visitar Rápidos de Kaimoran es gratis.

Estacionamento de um hotel onde tem também uma estação de serviço solo gasolina . os Rápidos de Kaimoran é grátis.

name: Posada Los Nonos
description: Basic hotel with secure parking for a car or a few motorcycle. We found this place through a recommendation of another biker. The place itself was okayyy but the staff and the communication where somewhat weird. They charge 45 USD for a small matrimonial room and between 5-10 USD for breakfast. It was our 1st night in VEN after the enduring entry procedure in San Antonio so we were tired and decided to stay despite the rate etc. We had a room to the backyard. Early morning was power blackout and they started the generator and gone were peace and tranquility. Many mosquitoes also. There are several restaurants nearby plus a big supermarket “La Barrata”. Restaurant CasaMatina is highly recommended a bit pricey but excellent international and local food. We stayed 2 nights to get things organized and then traveled on to Presa La Honda.

name: Represa La Honda , Campamiento La Trampa
description: Wonderful quiet and peaceful location to come down a bit after hectic Cúcuta and San Cristóbal. We took the scenic road via Airport Santo Domingo and El Naranjal/Fundación. The campamento is huge and in a state of rebuilding. Entry is free but for camping they charge 12$ per night or 20$ incl breakfast for 2p. We could choose the camping location and decided to stay here in the kiosko (exact coordinates). We had the place to ourselves incl toilets and showers, Power outlets etc. After asking where to buy drinking water they immediately sent someone with a water gallon. Very attentive and friendly staff. We also joined a boat tour to the drowned village of Potosi where due to low water level we even could walk parts of the village and the famous church. Tour costs about 10$ pp. Absolutely recommended!  Note that there is no supermarket on the premises so stock up on provisions before. But just in case there is a restaurant for breakfast lunch and dinner. No phone signal here but they offer Internet at the reception, 2000 col peso for 30min. And YEs you can still pay with Peso colombiano here.

name: CasaMatina Restaurant
description: Good Restaurant with excellent international and local food. They also offer breakfast from 8:30 am. We ate there 2-3 times, excellent prepared steak, risotto, salad, soup, deserts. Coffee is also very good. A friendly and welcoming place, one of the better choices here in San Cristóbal. They accept cc, peso col, usd.

name: Gasolin for tourists
description: Our First gasolin in VEN coming in from Cúcuta. After seeing lots of closed gas stations and being denied by others before we finally could fill up our tanks here. 50 cents US per liter. Many cars in line and a crowd of motos in front of the station. All waiting desperately for there turn. We went directly to the front and talked to the man in charge. He got permission from the owner and we could fill up. They have a license plate system which days you’re allowed to buy gas and additionally at many places they accept only cars and no motos. The quality of the gasoline officially is 95 octane (there’s only one type) but the guy told us that in reality it’s much less. We need min 95 so we’re going to look buying additives to elevate the quality.

name: Tortas y Café
description: Good cafeteria close to RodeoPlaza and Central Market. Street parking in front with security. Excellent coffee and a wide variety of pastries and tortas. The owner Benito is a warm person and will help you with tipps in and around Mérida.

name: Panaderia Masa Madre
description: Bakery and Pastelería with a variety of real bread and pastries. They have sourdough bread. Also breakfast options from 7:30 am. Good coffee. Secure parking right in front.

name: Plaza
description: Wifi, free, next to the police station! Safe place to connect, not the best wifi, very slow but works.

name: Alex, Moto Repuestos y Taller
description: Good garage for all types of motorcycles, incl. big bikes. Alexander is very experienced and attentive. He was recommended to us by a KTM mechanic in Bogotá. He does KTM, BMW, Honda, Yamaha among others. His cell/whatapp is +58 4247169306.

name: Posada La Estancia de Bólivar
description:
Here you will find the perfect start for your time in Venezuela. Here you get information about San Cristobal, the area and the rest of Venezuela. Cesar and his family are very welcoming and will help you with any questions. There are always great networks in all parts of the country. Cesar has plenty of space for motorcycles and large vehicles here. He owns a workshop for motorcycles and can help quickly with problems. The room is $20 per night

Contact Cesar per WhatsApp:
+584147188308

name: Tienda Trochas Táchira
description:
Mechanics Shop. Parts available and excellent service.
.....
taller de motos. Aquí puede obtener repuestos y un excelente servicio.

name: Casa Angel del Sol - Colibri Garden
description: Unique place to watch, feed and learn more about colibríes. 5$ entry pp. Excellent informative introduction. Worth a visit.

name: E:S Becera Gas Station
description: Officially, the only gas station in Mérida which accept motos. We had no problems getting our tanks filled here. They seems to like tourists here. 0,50$ per liter. Might be closed in the afternoons.

name: Mistafi Hotel & Restaurant
description: We went here for breakfast. 6$ pp. They offer American, Creole or Andino breakfast. We stayed in another hotel close by which didn’t offer breakfast so this was a good alternative. They also offer rooms, e.g. 35$ for a matrimonial room incl breakfast. Secure parking around the corner.

name: Hotel Milla Suites
description: Good hotel with a nice park infront. Secure garage. Rooms with mountain view (we had no. 205) and king size beds. Paid 32$ per night, no breakfast. Very friendly staff.

name: La Mucutuyana Hospeda y Restaurant
description: We ate lunch here on the Canagua. 5$ for a big plate incl juice and coffee. They also offer accommodation 10$ single and 15$ matrimonial. All meals separate. Señora Anamaria es la jefa

name: Mucuposada Kiutrindú
description: Basic but clean accommodation. The only one in Chacantá. Señora Tomasá will welcome you with a warm heart. The place is basic but clean. No wifi no food. But drinking water, hot water for tea and she prepared good coffee. Prices are a bit up, we paid 25$ for a room for 2. Secure parking for 2-3 motos or a small car.

name: Hotel Oviedo
description:
Basic hotel close to the Center of Mérida. Save parking in the corner of the hotel also for big rig. 
25 Dollar per night.

name: Posada doña barbara
description:
Hotel with comfortable rooms for fishing lovers
-----------
Posada con confortables habitaciones para los amantes de la pesca

name: Isla doña barbara
description:
Island in the middle of the rio verde reservoir. Camping and fishing site
--------
Isla en medio del embalse de rio verde.  Sitio de campim y pesca

name: Aventura4wdvzla&camping
description:
Camping and parking for motorhomes and camping vehicles
----------
Campamento y estacionamiento para autocaravanas y vehiculos de camping

name: Laguna Mucubají
description:
The Laguna is part of national park Sierra Nevada. 40 VES entrance fee. NO MOTOS permitted to enter, cars yes. 'No go' for us, so we skipped this place sadly. 

Edit: $1 dolar for cars. Dogs allowed. If you walk in, it's free.

name: Police Check Point
description: An official in uniform stopped us. Asked for papers. Made me dismount and open a duffel bag and a pannier. Checked both thoroughly with his dirty ungloved hands until he reached the bottom. Made us feel very uneasy and uncomfortable. Asked all curious questions. And finally let us go. Only later we learned from a friend that we should have filmed the scene. There is a new law out in VE that it allows you to officially film such procedures to prevent corruption or more. He also said it had occurred more than once that somebody slips something into your belongings to only discover it later and extort some money with it. Next time we know better. Had been our first road check since we entered via Cúcuta.

name: Gata Loca
description: Nice little restaurant here in La Azulita. We park our bikes directly in front. We was very welcome here.

name: Posada El Tejar
description:
a very good place to stay. We made a quick stop here and even added a day's break. the posada has everything a sls traveler needs. the rooms have a small bathroom with them. there is good WiFi and Hektor, the proprietor, goes out of his way to make you feel comfortable. you can cook yourself and all the ingredients you need are only a few minutes walk in the small town. very close to the river there are caves that you can visit. in good weather you can see the lightning of Catatumbo from here.
We pay 15 $ per night.

name: Chalet Vistas de Oriana
description: Super nice posada with a spectacular view. They also offer delicious food for lunch and dinner. They have 2-3 matrimonial rooms and 1 suite with a king size bed. Various attractions on the premises, like open air jacuzzi, zip line, platforms with spectacular views, a hanging bridge. Trails in the surroundings to cascadas and pozos. Rates are 60$ matrimonial incl a rich breakfast. Call or Whatsapp +58 424-5855270 Irene or Cesar. Find the place on Instagram.

name: Gas station
description: Here we get Gasolina. We just ask and become 10l of gasolina.

name: Relámpago Suite
description: Unfortunately, we haven't found out a real name for this "hotel" yet. We asked people in town, and then we ended up here. But it's ok, and you have a great view of the cemetery. It's all very simple, but it will do for a night or two. It's the best we've found in town. We wanted to visit the Catatumbo from here. We paid 50000 COP for a night. The parking lot is locked and there is enough space for motorbikes or two cars. The Wi-Fi is not the fastest. Our room had a bathroom and air conditioning.

name: Military Checkpoint
description:
On this route, there are a lot of Police and Military Checkpoints. They just wanted to see our documents (Copy) and asked what we are doing here. 
Take it easy! We don't have to pay something.

name: Hotel Doral
description: one of the few decent hotels here in town. The crisis gives you the feeling of the end of time. Many of the buildings here are empty and the streets are littered with rubbish. However, this hotel has a very friendly welcome, a guarded and locked car park that is also suitable for large vehicles. The rooms are very tidy, air-conditioned and there is a bathroom. $25 per room

name: Gasstation
description: Get gas here. The only between Maracaibo and Coro. 0,50$ Liter.

name: Hotel Intercaribe Plaza
description: Budget hotel close to the old town of Coros. the rooms are simply furnished. each room has air conditioning and a bathroom. everything is reasonably clean. the parking lot is locked and guarded. we paid $20 for the room.

name: No Gasolina
description: In the north of the country, supplying petrol stations with petrol is very problematic. Especially on the route between Maracaibo and Coro you hardly get any petrol. We found a gas station 30km before Coro that had petrol. So, fill everything up with petrol beforehand if you can.

name: Puente General Rafael Urdaneta
description: A toll must be paid to drive over the bridge. It is not allowed to transport petrol in additional canisters across the bridge.

name: Villa Victoria Suite
description:
Nice clean Posada with a big safe parking area. 20$ for a double room with a king size bed. Good internet, no breakfast but  a place where you can eat your own things and you can heat water for coffee or tea. 
instagr.am/villavictoriaposada

name: Casa del Cabo
description: What an amazing place. we happened upon this place when we wanted to go to the Capo San Roman lighthouse. however, after a few beers and a super delicious meal, we couldn't drive anymore... each cabana seats 15 people. however, the houses are not cheap at $150 per night. we got a slightly cheaper room. Just speak with Juan.

name: PDVSA Gasstation
description: You get fuel here. Paid 0,50$ per Liter

name: Posada Chama Tour
description: A simple but beautiful posada in Chichiriviche. the rooms have air conditioning and a bathroom. There is a kitchen and WiFi in the yard. we paid $25 a night.

name: Posada Bahía de Patanemo
description: A beautiful posada in Patanemo. Very nice rooms and there is even a pool. we pay $20 dollars per night. The motorcycles are safely behind the house and are guarded. You can walk to the beach from here. On the other side of the mountain is the Laguna de Yapascua. a paradise. Here you can see glowing algae at night.

name: Posada Mérida Vacacional
description: It is a new cheap inn with apartments with kitchen and rooms, it also has a large parking lot where you can park your motorhome. It has a good shower with hot water, WiFi and laundry service, there are several tourist spots in the area and it is quiet. It is recommended to contact the owner in advance Frank +584143743376

name: Restaurant Rumbach
description: a great restaurant in Tovar. we recommend the goulash with spaetzle. the staff is super friendly and can give you tips for the city or for cheap accommodation.

name: Hotel Freiburg
description: A good hotel managed by Jürgen. he speaks perfect German and we had a lot to tell. he even has a brewery museum next door. we paid $20 for one night. Safe parking for our motorcycles. Jürgen's brother has a car workshop and can help with defects.

name: Refugio Mucubají
description:
At the entrance to the Mucubají Lagoon there is a restaurant, Refugio Mucubají, which has a large and flat parking lot. It closes at night but it allows you to stop there. It is quiet, the area cared for by the same neighbors and with an incredible landscape. In the Park there are several trails to do. The wheat arepas with chorizo and smoked cheese are delicious.
-------------------
En el ingreso a la Laguna Mucubají hay un restaurante, Refugio Mucubají,  que tiene un amplio y plano estacionamiento. cierra a la noche pero permite parar ahí. Es tranquilo, la zona cuidada por los mismos vecinos y con un paisaje increíble.  En el Parque hay varios senderos para hacer. Las arepas de trigo con chorizo y queso ahumado son riquísimas.

name: Ecoposada Casa Maria Bugparadise
description: Norbert & Gabys place is a upscale posada with live for details and nature paradise. Check-in for camping here also. They offer various accommodation and excellent food. Norbert is a biologist and will take time to show interested people around and explain nature to them in all its varieties. Must stop for nature lovers. Instagram @posadaecologicacasamaria

name: Hostal Nova Colonial
description:
A safe place to parc the vehicles (the gate is high, Minibus can enter probably- all depends). The Hostal is also close to the beach (Playa Grande) and Malecon (Puerto Colombia), both in walking distance. Minimercados on the opposite, nothing is missing. Rooms are with or without Aircondition, kept simple. Pricelist you can find attached in Photos. A huge garden with Pool and they also wash your laundry here by hand. Chilling area, and Restaurant in the same property. Food is good, if you stay, they give you 15 percent discount when you eat here. Breakfast also available. Claudia, a German Citizen is the Owner.
Everything else, please check the Pricelist in photos.

name: Levando Pan
description: Handmade bread de Masa Madre and Sweets also. They do serve Breakfast, Coffee, Empanadas, Foccacia - all is very good too, it’s a tiny Restaurant inside and has really great Products. You can parc easily in front of the shop, big windows to see your vehicle. We highly recommend this place, but better bring cash money! Great guys.

name: Sorokaima Guesthouse
description:
Good and economic place to stay a few nights in Caracas. The guesthouse has 2 rooms to offer, 1 matrimonial and a quadruple. Prices per night around 40 USD. Location approx 12 km from center. Can use a taxi (yummy app) for about 8$ per drive. Groceries and restaurants in walking distance. Nice view over Caracas from here. Quiet surroundings. Orangel is a very helpful and welcoming host. Our room had a microwave, a coffee machine and even a small stove. Refrigerator outside in front of the room. Secure parking for 1-2 cars or a few motorcycles. 
Cel/Whatsapp +58 412-3560578

name: Posada El Encanto
description: A must stop in the valley of Sanare. Wonderful posada with a wonderful host (Manuel) and staff. Excellent attention and food. Spectacular views and sunsets. Among countless places we stayed this is a real gem. We stayed 2 nights, relaxed completely and enjoyed the tasty food. Rates are not cheap but worth every cent. From 60$ per night incl outstanding breakfast.

name: Tasca Pizzeria
description: Good pizza place. They also serve other food but we did not really expect such a good pizza here. They also manage the posada next corner. Niquitao seems a good place to stop and rest for a night or two.

name: Posada Turistica Niquitao
description: Nice but basic place to spend the night. Payed 20$ per night for a matrimonial room. Location right on the plaza. Groceries and restaurant nearby. Secure parking for cars and motos. Clean. No Wi-Fi, but right there at the plaza you have Wi-Fi. The Valley and the surroundings are really beautiful. The scenic road from Boconó in direction Mérida is in good shape, all paved.

name: Movistar- Main Office
description:
We were able to buy the Movistar chip in the ground floor store. They only asked us for a passport and an address (we gave them COTATUR's). In the main office on the second floor they asked us for an invoice for accommodation. It cost us 11 USD for the chip and 15 USD per month for the 25G plan and we were able to pay by card.
.....
Pudimos comprar el chip de movistar en el local de planta baja. Solo nos pidieron pasaporte y una dirección (le dimos la del COTATUR). En la sede principal del segundo piso nos pedian factura de un alojamiento.

Nos costos 11 USD el chip y 15 USD mensual el plan de 25G y pudimos pagar con tarjeta.

.

name: SENIAT TIP checkout
description: Here you give your TIP back leaving VE. Took about 15 min for 2 motos. You‘ll get a receipt and an exit stamp into the passport. Go there directly BEFORE exiting VE.

name: Posada El Andes
description: nice and quiet hostel between the pass and Merída. We paid $20 for a 6 person room. there is warm water. it can get really cold up here

name: Hojani
description:
Food court with ample parking, with security personnel suitable for motorhomes. Also the food is very tasty and the staff is very friendly.
----------
Patio de comidas con estacionamiento amplio, con personal de seguridad apto para motorhome. Además la comida es muy rica y el personal es muy amable

name: Misia Crema
description: Misia Crema Pizzeria, excellent pizzas at a very good price

name: Camping La Romana (Campito Rafael)
description:
Close to the PAC Romana. Rafael and his grandson Jose Andre are welcoming overlanders. I was here with my bicycle and enjoyed a wonderful time.

Contact José Andrés via Whattsapp +584148848731 or Instagram @campinglaromana

name: Hotel Turístico Varyna
description:
Nice and good Hotel here in Barinas. Safe parking for cars and motorcycles. 
Pay 15$ Dollar for room

name: Hotel Barcelos
description:
Simple and cheap hotel here in Trujillo. 
12 $Dollar for Room without Clima
17 $Dollar for Room with Clima
Save parking for motorcycle

name: PDV GasStation
description:
Seems like these days gasoline is available 24/7 here at this station and they didn’t have a queue or number plate system while I was there. But, it wasn’t the case in Merida or San Cristobal or El Vigia. There still gasoline shortage and queques over there. $0.50 per liter.

Either way if you find yourself in a queue, just go ahead and talk to the guard about you being a travelers and that should usually help you skip the queue.

name: Posada Don Pablito
description:
Stays in Venezuela aren’t expensive if you know how to and where to look. Posadas are cheap way to stay the night. This one in Barinas is the cheapest I’ve found. $10 for Matrimonial bed and $15 for a matrimonial and a bunk bed. Has a lot of parking for motos and cars in their secured open top yard. You could probably camp too. Owners very friendly and accommodating. Lots of cheap fast food nearby. 

PS- No shortage of fuel in Barinas right now. fuel is easily available as of now.

name: Motorhome Park Lechería
description: The first motorhome park in Venezuela, near the Civil Protection building.

name: Campamento Tapuy Lodge
description:
a very nice accommodation from Mariella. here you can either take a room for up to 4 people or set up a tent on the property. Just write Mariella via WhatsApp and discuss everything else with her.
+58 4263913209

name: Carlo’s Biker
description: I came here for my moto repair. It’s specifically for motorcycle repairs. Very knowledgeable people. I had to change my sparkplugs again within 7 days of changing them. Get SPARE SPARK PLUGS. The gasoline quality is very bad. Or add additives to the gasoline every time you buy. Good luck.

name: valle de Río negro
description:
beautiful and peaceful site, you need an off road vehicle or motorcycle to get there you can set your camp next to the river

un lugar muy bello y pacifico espectacular para acampar se necesita un vehículo rústico o una motocicleta todo terreno para llegar

name: Arbol redondo
description: it's a gas station most part of time is closed but you can park there safely, is the highest point on the road and has awesome weather 16 C°  there is a small restaurant you can ask for bathroom but is not open at nights

name: Restaurant Pa Que el General
description:
We came here to eat fish.
We had fish for 8$ for two persons.
Very fresh food.
You can pass the night on the park site, if you ask. Nice sight to the lake and bridge.

name: HOKU Turismo
description:
This site is good to pass a quiet and safe night. This is posible inside the court as well as outside on the street. Police near by.
Marvellous people. Water (no potable) avaiable.
Restaurantes and beach nearby.
Viviane y Cesar can help with any activity conserning excursions and activities in the national parc of Morrocoy y Chichiriviche.

name: Plaza Bolívar de Barquisimeto
description:
You can park on the street and spend the night to continue your trave

sitio para pasar la noche con seguridad

name: Area de Parking
description:
Parking for international travelers near the police station you can park there with security and some services nearby.  This site is a contribution by the San Francisco city mayor and the Venezuelan travelers' support network. 

Parqueadero para viajeros internacionales cerca de la policía, ahí se pueden estacionar y pasar la noche hay servicios básicos cerca este sitio esta disponible gracias a la colaboración de la alcaldía de San Francisco y la red de apoyo a viajeros de Venezuela @viajeros.ve en redes sociales

name: Sabor Tropical
description:
restaurant friends of the tourist in Lechería, Anzoátegui, Venezuela
Un restaurante que apoya al turismo nacional y extranjero en el país, ubicado e Lechería, Anzoátegui.

name: Camping playa Puerto Escondido
description:
Translation: This place is very cute. José the owner is organizing a campsite. For now he charges a voluntary contribution. Place surrounded by military that adds security to the place. It provides water and energy.

Este lugar es muy lindo. José el propietario está organizando un camping. Por ahora cobra una contribución voluntaria. Lugar rodeado de militares que le agrega seguridad al lugar. Provee agua y energía.

name: Buchuaco Hotel
description:
Translation: This is a hotel with a very large patio where they allow you to park your motorhome, with connection to electricity, running water, Internet, swimming pool, bathrooms... super complete. They charged us $15.00 a night with all these services. It also has a bar-restaurant that was about to open. The place is extremely quiet and safe.

Este es un hotel con un patio muy grande donde permiten estacionar el motorhome,  con conexión a energía eléctrica, agua corriente, Internet, piscina, baños... super completo. Nos cobraron U$ 15,00 la noche con todos estos servicios. Tiene también un bar-restaurante que se estaba por inaugurar. El lugar extremadamente tranquilo y seguro.

name: Vibe de Dois: El Sol Posada
description:
El Sol hostel is part of a network that supports travelers in Venezuela. They provide the hostel grounds free of charge for sleeping. They also lend out the bathroom. They are very kind and also work as tour guides, giving great recommendations of places to visit in Táchira. Everything is very clean and tidy. A very quiet and safe place to sleep. The gate has a height limit, so if you want to enter the courtyard, you'd better check first! To stay in a room at the hostel, there are special conditions for travelers! Contact details in the photos!
---
A Pousada El Sol faz parte da rede de apoio a viajantes na Venezuela. Eles concedem gratuitamente o terreno da pousada para dormir. Também emprestam o banheiro. São muito gentis, e também trabalham como guias de turismo, dando ótimas recomendações de lugares para conhecer em Táchira. Tudo muito limpo e ordenado. Lugar super tranquilo e seguro para dormir. O portão tem limite de altura, para entrar no pátio, melhor verificar antes! Para ficar hospedado em um quarto da pousada, há condições especiais para viajantes! Contato da pousada nas fotos!

name: Playita doña barbara
description:
Camping site on the banks of the tiznados river reservoir

Sitio de acampada a orillas del embalse del rio tiznados

name: Vibe de Dois: La Porquera
description:
Very beautiful, quiet and safe place to sleep on the way to Merida. Nereida takes care of the park on the left side of the track and said that it will be a pleasure to receive other travelers. On the other side of the track, there is also another huge park, taken care of by a park ranger. It provides a faucet with water, bathrooms and even an outlet if you need it. There is no 4G signal from Digitel, but if you have electricity, you can get the Wi-Fi password from Nereida, who lives opposite.
----
Lugar muito bonito, tranquilo e seguro pra dormir no caminho até Merida. Nereida cuida do parque do lado esquerdo da pista e disse que será um prazer receber outros viajantes. Do outro lado da pista, também há outro parque enorme, cuidado por um guarda parques. Ela disponibiliza uma torneira com agua, banheiros e até uma tomada se precisar. Não há sinal de 4G da Digitel, mas se tiver eletricidade, pode conseguir a senha do Wi-Fi de Nereida, que mora em frente.

name: Natural source
description:
Potable water, natural source.
You have to take it from the small source on the right hand side.

name: Vibe de Dois: Posada Tramontana
description:
We were invited by Posada Tramontana to stay here for a few days. The inn is beautiful, clean and very organized. The rooms are spacious, the shower hot. Parking is large and secure. The location is great, close to the center, you can walk to everything. Values ​​in the photos. It has delicious breakfast and a restaurant that opens some days at night.
---
Fomos convidados pela Posada Tramontana para ficar uns dias aqui. A pousada é linda, limpa e muito organizada. Os quartos são amplos, o chuveiro quente. Estacionamento é grande e seguro. A localização é ótima, perto do centro, possível fazer tudo a pé. Valores nas fotos. Tem café da manhã delicioso e um restaurante que abre alguns dias a noite.

name: Puerto Filter CA
description: This is where I was taken by the locals to buy some additive for gasoline. It’s 1/2 littler for 20L tank and costs $2.50 for 1 liter. I believe it’s methanol and it’s used by race biking community in Puerto Cabello for improving the performance and bettering the quality of gasoline.

name: Moto Bros
description: Josué is a very knowledgeable moto mechanic. They were able to diagnose the engine problem I had and were able to fix it. Venezuelans are amazing. They went above and beyond to fix the engine problem. We thought it was the valve clearance, but it ended up being much more complicated than that and had to disassemble the engine. Definitely recommended.

name: Street Parking
description:
There are several residential streets, with many small buildings (3 to 4 floors). The cars of the neighbors of the buildings are on the street, so there are many spaces available and it seems to be a very safe area. The ideal would be not to spend too many days in the same parking lot, we suggest changing the parking lots throughout the day, having a rotation, so that the neighbors do not get upset. It has a small square and in several main streets fairs throughout the day. It also has a market, a bakery and a pharmacy (but this street is busier, it is difficult to find a place there). We did not find any kind of facility nearby.
.....
São várias ruas residenciais, com muitos prédios pequenos (3 a 4 andares). Os carros dos moradores dos prédios ficam na rua, então tem muitas vagas disponíveis e parece ser uma região muito segura. O ideal seria não ficar muitos dias parado na mesma vaga, sugerimos ir trocando de vaga ao longo do dia, para ter uma rotatividade, até para os moradores não se incomodarem. Tem uma pequena praça e em várias ruas principais feiras ao longo do dia. Também tem um mercado, padaria e farmácia (mas essa rua é mais movimentada, difícil arrumar vaga ali). Não encontramos nenhum tipo de facilidade por perto.
_____

Hay varias calles residenciales, con muchos edificios pequeños (3 a 4 pisos). Los carros de los vecinos de los edificios están en la calle, por lo que hay muchos espacios disponibles y parece ser una zona muy segura. Lo ideal sería no pasar demasiados días en el mismo estacionamiento, sugerimos cambiar los estacionamientos a lo largo del día, tener una rotación, para que los vecinos no se molesten. Tiene una pequeña plaza y en varias calles principales ferias durante todo el día. También tiene un mercado, una panadería y una farmacia (pero esta calle es más concurrida, es difícil encontrar un lugar allí). No encontramos ningún tipo de instalación cerca.

name: Aqua Express
description:
100% pure water filtered by physical and chemical procedures, suitable for human consumption.

Agua pura 100% filtrada por procedimientos físicos y químicos, apta para consumo humano.

name: Vibe de Dois: Supermercado Fort
description:
Very large wholesale market with excellent prices. It has open parking with no height limit, accepts credit cards and there is a small shopping center with general stores.
---
Mercado atacadista muito grande e com excelentes preços. Tem estacionamento aberto sem limite de altura, aceita cartão de crédito e fica um pequeno centro comercial, com lojas gerais.

name: Cuerpo de Bomberos
description:
We stayed in front of the fire brigade, they let us have electricity and water. Super attentive and with good energy.

Nos quedamos frente al cuerpo de bomberos, nos dejaron quedar con energía eléctrica y agua. Super atentos y con buena energía.

name: Posada Boca Beach
description:
This inn has parking where they receive a motorhome, it has a swimming pool, showers, electricity connection, non-potable water, WiFi Cantv, 24-hour security, a bar where they serve drinks on weekends and a restaurant every day.
.....
Esta posada tiene estacionamiento donde reciben motorhome, tiene piscina, duchas, conexión de energía eléctrica, agua no potable, WiFi Cantv, vigilancia 24 horas, bar donde sirven tragos los fines de semana y restaurante todos los días.

name: Aikoz Supermarket
description:
Supermarket open 24 hrs. 

Automercado abierto las 24 horas.

name: Vainilla
description:
Small coffee and bakery, free wifi, good parking.

FREE COFFEE FOR INTERNATIONAL TRAVELERS

name: Universidad Central de Venezuela
description:
We were in that parking lot for one night. We arrived at dusk. Quiet and safe place. In the morning when leaving a gentleman asked for a "colaboracion", it seems that he is here as security during the day.
------------
Estivemos nesse estacionamento por uma noite. Chegamos já anoitecendo. Lugar tranquilo e seguro. Pela manhã ao sair um senhor pediu uma "colaboracion", parece que ele fica aqui como segurança durante o dia

Estuvimos en ese estacionamiento por una noche. Llegamos al anochecer. Lugar tranquilo y seguro. Por la mañana al salir un señor pidió "colaboración", parece que está aquí como seguridad durante el día.

name: Lavanderia San Jorge
description: Loundry services wash and dry, selve  service 30$ three machines.

name: Agua las Colina
description:
Filtred potable water. 20 l at 0.5$
Parking in front of magazine

name: RECARGA Agua
description: You can get filtrated water here. Water is potable. 3x20l for 1 $.

name: Hotel La Peninsula
description:
We were out of water and couldn't get it elsewhere, so we had to come to a hotel. The hotel is good, the rooms are very clean, the air conditioning is working and the shower has hot water. It also has a swimming pool and restaurant, but we didn't use them. There's no breakfast and the internet is very bad. It accepts small dogs. $20 dollars per couple.
---
Estávamos sem água, e não conseguimos em outros lugares, por isso tivemos que vir para um hotel. O hotel é bom, os quartos são bem limpos, ar condicionado funcionando, chuveiro com água quente. Também tem uma piscina e restaurante, mas não fomos utilizar. Não tem café da manhã e à internet é muito ruim. Aceita cachorros de pequeno porte. $20 dólares por casal.

____

We were without water, and we couldn't get it elsewhere, so we had to go to a hotel. The hotel is good, the rooms are very clean, air conditioning working, shower with hot water. It also has a pool and restaurant, but we didn't use it. No breakfast and internet is very bad. Accepts small dogs. $20 dollars per couple.

name: Salto Chorreron
description: Come here and call the number - 04148821129 - Onier Garcia. He lives in town will be more than happy to show you the way to Salto Chorreron. It’s a beautiful waterfall with enough rain on the prior days. Google the name or check my Instagram. PS - It’s a moderate to hard hike with 3.5kms one way. Don’t forget to tip Onier.

name: Rancho De José Marin
description: Mega beautiful quiet beach with a fantastic view. Camping is possible. Small, simple restaurant that also serves breakfast. there is also delicious fish

name: Posada Playa Colorada
description:
Nice and clean Posada. We pay 20$ per night for the room. The room have a small kitchen, clean bathroom with two separate toilets. All rooms climate. Save parking for Motorcycles and Cars n the yard. 
You can use the pool in the garden.

name: Melanias Place
description: Apartment in which its rooms are rented. It is comfortable and very familiar. We have 3 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms that can be rented separately. we are pet friendly and we have years of experience in tourism and transportation

name: Posada Boca Beach
description: We stayed 3 days in this amazing inn! Welcoming, friendly and very sweet people. They provide water and electricity and have a space for Motorhomes, motorcycles, cars and tents. Very safe and there is a direct access to the beach. It has a swimming pool and also has rooms.

name: La canchita de Mochima
description: Mobile homes can stay in this place, they have electricity. The place is super safe and they are planning to install taps for water intake and drainage. When they arrive, contact: Gloris Muñoz ±584267986348 Ricardo Malave ±584264901163

name: Recarfa de AGUA
description:
You can get potable water here.
20l for 0.5$.
Open from 08:00-20:00 (Mo-Sa), 08:00-14:00 (So)

name: Posada el Portal de los Sueños
description:
This place works as an inn and receives motorhomes. It has barbecue areas, a swimming pool with running water (stream), electricity and WiFi. The place is quiet, very safe. Ideal to spend a few quiet days. It has a grill to make barbecues.
You can call Ms. Pili with cell phone number ±584241656437
.....
Este lugar funciona como posada y recibe Motorhome. Tiene quinchos, piscina con agua corriente (arroyo), energía eléctrica y WiFi. El lugar es tranquilo, muy seguro. Ideal para pasar unos días tranquilos. Tiene parrilla para hacer asados.
Good Movistar reception but not really fast. 
Puede llamar a la Sra. Pili con celular número ±584241656437

name: Inparque Gran Sabana
description: They let us safely park our motorhome and spend the night at their yard uphill. They offered us water and a shower. We ended up bathing in the river next to the bridge. Overall amazing and quiet night with a beautiful view.

name: Cancha de Mochima
description:
The tourism secretary of Mochina and Inparque are in charge of this space where you can stay with RV's.
The place is safe, near the pier, it offers electricity. Water coming soon.
Upon arrival contact:
Ricardo de Inparque +584264901163 or
Tourism Gloris ±584267986348

La secretaria de turismo de Mochina e Inparque están a cargo de este espacio donde se pueden quedar con casas rodantes.
El lugar es seguro, cerca del embarcadero, ofrece energía eléctrica. Próximamente agua.
Al llegar contactarse con:
Ricardo de Inparque +584264901163 o
Gloris de Turismo  ±584267986348

name: Fundo Cunaguaro
description:
Camping place for foreign tourists, free, with access to electricity and water. Motor home, van life, camping. For stays, request prior authorization at +584147868556
.....
Somos un lugar de camping para turistas extranjeros, gratis con acceso a electricidad y agua. Motor home, van life, camping.
Para estadías solicitar previa autorización al +584147868556
.....
Somos um parque de campismo para turistas estrangeiros, gratuito com acesso a electricidade e água. Motor home, vida em van, camping. Para estadias, solicite autorização prévia pelo telefone +584147868556

name: Motorhome Park Zoológico La Guaricha Maturin
description:
The MotorHome Park La Guaricha Maturin Zoo presents traveling friends, tourists and adventure lovers to enjoy the facilities of the largest and most biodiverse Zoo in the East of the country, which will provide our international visitors with protection, logistics, advice, security and guarantee for a campsite immersed in the beautiful fauna and flora of the zoo.!
--------
El MotorHome Park Zoológico La Guaricha Maturin presenta a los amigos viajeros, turistas y amantes de la aventura a disfrutar las instalaciones del Zoológico más grande y con mayor biodiversidad del Oriente del país el cual brindará a nuestros visitantes internacionales la protección, logística, asesoramiento, seguridad y garantía para un camping sumergido en la hermosa fauna y flora del zoológico.!

Para disfrutar de este servicio de camping gratuito para turistas internacional se debe tramitar un permiso a través de las cuentas de Instagram @rutero4wd y @luis4wd 

O MotorHome Park Zoológico La Guaricha Maturin convida amigos viajantes, turistas e amantes de aventura para desfrutarem das instalações do maior e mais biodiverso Zoológico do Leste do país, que proporcionará aos nossos visitantes internacionais proteção, logística, assessoria, segurança e garantia para um acampamento imerso na bela fauna e flora do zoológico.!

name: Posada Saucedos
description: Very nice Hotel with very friendly owners at this little beach village. Payed 15$ per night for an aircon room with private bathroom. Food is amazing and cheap.

name: Hotel Moto Refugio Campo Bello
description: Members of the travelers support group, they accept international travellers free of charge, in return for wanting to share stories and share their home with you! Large camping ground at the back of the hotel, they receive travelers on bikes or motorhomes. The place is like a small farm with and open area, view to the mountains, avocado and mango trees. Super quiet place and super friendly people. They also work as base camp, you can leave your stuff and pickup later. The family that owns the place are amazing people and very supportive. A toilet, cold shower, fridge, gas stove and potable water are available. As of Jan '24, they are in the final stages of completing an outdoor cooking/grill area too

name: Entrance to Cape San Roman
description:
When you reach this point, you should take the dirt road on the right-hand side of the path, just after seeing the road sign. You should drive on a dirt road for approximately 8 - 10 minutes until you reach the lighthouse. The road can be traversed by sedan vehicles with caution.

MODERATOR NOTE:  Moved GPS point onto Via Cabo San Román because a user reported it was unclear. (See warning for the road to avoid.)
---
Al llegar a este punto, debe tomar el camino de tierra que se encuentra a mano derecha del camino, justo después de ver el aviso vial. Debe conducir por un camino de tierra por aproximadamente 8  - 10 minutos hasta llegar al faro. El camino puede ser transitado por vehículos sedan con prudencia.

name: Checkpoint Guarda Civil
description: Next to the airport, checkpoint from Guarda Civil. Needs passport and then radio (well.. whatsapp) to commandante for permission. Took about 20 minutes. We were offered coffee while waiting.

name: La Pasion de Pili
description:
This Chiringuito has excellent food at a reasonable price and all overlooking the sea.
Pili is the kitchen.
Este Chiringuito tiene una comida excelente con precio raconable y todo esto con vista al mar.
Pili es la cocinera.

name: Posada Katary
description:
Posada Katary is a small oasis. It has 4 clean and tastefully furnished rooms with shower, toilet.
It has a parking space for mobile homes, separate shower, toilet.
A tent can be provided.
Katary also offers a paid laundry service.
You can also order breakfast or smaller meals with or without a room.
The people are very accommodating and friendly.
The Katary is a good place as a starting point for the Gran Sabana.

name: Brisas Del Pauji
description: Best views of Pauji! Perched on top of a hill, Eliakim and Radha are building a little paradise. They have rooms/cabanas with the most spectacular views and you can also camp. There is a little minimarket with the essentials. They are both children of original founders of Pauji and have many stories to tell about the past and the present (mining). Work is in progress for a swimming pool too. Highly recommended!

name: free parking lot
description:
Restaurant parking, free, good for staying a few days in your vehicle. Quiet and safe, it is next to a military base and a neighborhood restaurant. There is no bathroom but there is a "shower" type water tank for rinsing. Beautiful Caribbean beach 20 meters away, windsurf point.
Don Rafael is the owner of the restaurant and has rooms available as well. He likes to receive travelers
--
Estacionamiento de restaurante, gratis, bueno para quedarse unos dias en tu vehiculo. Tranquilo y seguro, está al lado de una base militar y un restaurant de barrio. No hay baño pero hay un tanque de agua para enjuagarse tipo "ducha". Playa hermosa caribeña a 20 metros, windsurf point.
Don Rafael es el dueño del restaurante y tiene habitaciones disponibles tambien. Le gusta recibir viajeros

name: Hotel escuela todariquiba
description:
25 usd per person , big bed! With swimming pool. Safe park ! For bike or big trucks
Near the historic centre 
No wifi in rooms, but yes in pool or reception

name: Lavandería La Paz
description:
We did the laundry here and were happy with the quality of service. The price is $7 for 20 items including ironing, but we negotiated the same price for our 30 items without ironing - so they are flexible. The cloth were ready in about 2.5 hours.
Working hours are 8-16 Mon-Fri, and a 8-12 (or something like that) on Saturday.

name: Lavandería Lechería (laundry service)
description:
🇬🇧Laundry service for baskets of clothes, according to the common load of a home washing machine. 
USD 5$ per basket. 

🇪🇸 servicio de lavandería, por cestas de ropa, calculado según la carga normal de una lavadora de hogar. Costo de 5 dólares por cada cesta.

name: Hostel posada El solaz del viñedo
description:
Great place! Clean! Air , tv. Good bed! 
Can park bike and cars !
If you come tell Soraya the owner, very kind woman, that you contact by this app or by me! She will help others traveler’s!
Her whats app is +58 (0) 4124416644

name: Sendero de Puertas de miraflores
description:
It is the trail parking lot.
You can spend the night next to the Guarapiche River. The shortest river a few steps away.
The path to the Miraflores gate is a 2km walk.
Water can be obtained from neighbors by asking.
The place is spectacular, the night is quiet.
Monday to Friday quiet, on weekends it is busier with local tourism.
Information by +58 4249743053 (Acosta municipality tourism office).

__________________________

Es el parking del sendero.
Se puede pernoctar al lado del rio Guarapiche. El rio mas corto a unos pasos.
El sendero hasta la puerta de Miraflores son 2km andando.
Agua se puede conseguir de los vecinos preguntando.
El lugar es spectacular, la noche tranquillito.
Lunes a viernes tranquilo, los fines de semana esta mas movido por turismo local.
Informaciones por +58 4249743053 (oficina turismo de municipio Acosta).

name: Miel Sabana
description: Buying a pot of honey here is the perfect excuse to explore this magic part of le gran sabana. Truly magnificent honey! They have different tastes depending on the area where the bees are kept. All produced artisanal. If you ask friendly, they’ll even squeeze you in an impressive beekeeping suit and take you to the fields to show you how it’s done. You can camp in front of their gate too if you want (no facilities). When entering their property (on foot!), take the road on the right! Left road leafs you straight into a beehive

name: E/S Pozuelos
description: Diesel available, cash only payment, USD or Bs

name: Amgarage blue def.  Ad blue
description:
Sale of urea additives ad blue .blue def
-------------
Venta de aditivos de urea  ad blue .blue def

name: Relampago del catatumbo. Ologa
description:
Village of stilt houses on the waters of Lake Maracaibo
  Where the unique phenomenon in the world of catatumbo lightning is observed
Contact +584124069728
----------------
Pueblo de palafitos sobre aguas del lago maracaibo
 Donde se observa el fenómeno único en el mundo del relámpago del catatumbo 
Contactar +584124069728
