name: Posada Turística La Cascada
description:
A cozy family hotel, located in a favorable part of the city of San Cristobol. We were offered a spacious room for two, with air conditioning, hot shower and Wi-Fi, costing $20 per night. Motorcycle parking is located right in the house, the doors are locked.
Very responsive and kind hosts who will definitely help if you need help.
-------
Уютная семейная гостиница, находится в благоприятной части города Сан Кристоболь. Нам предложили просторный номер на двоих, с кондиционером, горячем душем и Wi-Fi, стоимостью 20$ за ночь. Парковка для мотоцикла находится прямо в доме, двери закрываются на замок.
Очень отзывчивые и добрые хозяева, которые обязательно помогут, если вам нужна будет помощь.

name: Mi Huacalito Sabenero
description: Your only option to buy supplies between Pauji and Icabaru (both are only 30km away, but it takes about 3 hours heavy offroad driving). Tiny shop, but they have all the essentials. They also make some savory bread rolls around lunch time. Not cheap, but understandebly because it is so remote.

name: Montaña Mágica
description: Breathtaking views, nice breeze. There is a 4wd track that leads to just below the top of montaña mágica, there is a flat area where you can camp. It’s 15min hike to the top from here. This place is of great importance to the local community, while you are welcome to camp here, it is of upmost importance to respect the place, no fires, no littering,… . Local legend claims many magical experiences can be felt here! Be careful: there are active beehives (aggressive) in the area, stay away from them! You are safe on the spot at the top.

name: El Abismo
description: Great views of the Abismo. Nice hike trough the Savanah to get there. The hike starts at Campamento Cantarana (where this point is logged), ask for directions/permission there. 45 mins up. I have created a wikiloc gpx track as the track is sometimes difficult to follow. https://nl.wikiloc.com/routes-wandelen/el-abismo-cantarana-149713670 The campamento is not operational at the moment, but they have plans to reopen. We were allowed to camp anyway, great place. They have a super nice waterfall to swim in too.

name: FARMATODO
description:
Pharmacy open 24/7 and medical services & first aid. 

Farmacia abierta 24 horas, servicios médicos primarios y compras varias.

name: Parque Nacional La Sirena
description:
It is a National Park with several waterfalls but the main waterfall called La Sirena is very beautiful and is 30 meters high.
Admission is free, there is parking and a 400-meter walk to the waterfall. It is recommended to go from Monday to Thursday because on weekends it is packed with local people.

name: E/S Diorca
description: Diesel Available, easy access and few vehicles

name: Plaza Peribeca
description:
Quiet place to spend a night. We talked to neighbors and they told us it was very safe and quiet during the week. On Sundays you cannot park in the square as it is very busy. Perfect for spending the night before or after crossing the border. recommended it! 
———- 
Lugar tranquilo para pasar una noche. Hablamos con los vecinos y nos dijeron que era muy seguro y tranquilo entre semana. Los domingos no se puede estacionar en la plaza ya que es muy concurrido. Perfecto para hacer noche antes o después de hacer frontera. Se recomienda!

name: Posada Casa Las Trinitarias
description:
Amazing Posada with several rooms private bahrooms and a shared kitchen where you can cook the fresh fish you bought at the beach. Internet is fast enough to work with video calls. 
You can also rent a house inside the area. there you have your own kitchen. It's cheap you can park your vehicle and the owner is super friendly and helpful. Highlight is the small pool. I really love the place and stayed a month.

name: Potable Water
description:
Tap with drinking water, the tank can be filled. 
Talk to Nereida, the owner of the place. 
———- 
Grifo con agua potable, el agua viene de la montaña y es filtrada, se puede conectar una manguera y llenar el tanque de la camper. 
Hablar con Nereida, ella es muy amable y te indica el lugar del grifo

name: Parking Cascada India Curu
description:
We spent one night here, it is in the parking lot of the India Curú waterfall (beautiful and recommended), it was late to continue on the trip to Merida and the park rangers allowed us to stay here. They are very kind. They told us that it is a very safe place, on weekends people may come to listen to music. The waterfall costs 1 dollar to enter and it is very beautiful!

Estuvimos una noche aquí, es en el estacionamiento de la casacada India Curú (hermosa y recomendable), era tarde para seguir en viaje a Merida y los guarda parques nos permitieron quedarte aquí. Son muy amables. Nos dijeron que es un lugar muy seguro, los fines de semana es posible que venga gente a escuchar música. La cascada cuesta 1 dolar la entrada y es muy linda!
Hay agua potable

name: Roraima views
description: On the road to Paraitepuy. Large flat space on higher ground with great views of Roraima and the sabana. Close to the road, but not a lot of traffic here anyway…

name: Water tap
description:
Water tap, is located on a soccer field. It is on the inside of the soccer field next to the wire net. Hose can be connected.

—————

Grifo de agua, se encuentra en una cancha de fútbol. 
Esta del lado de adentro de la canch,  al lado del alambrado.  Se puede conectar la manguera

name: Quiet street at night
description:
We spent two nights here, it is a quiet place and we felt safe. It's not a pretty place but it's quiet at night.
———
Estuvimos dos noches aquí, es un lugar tranquilo por las noches y nos sentimos seguros. El lugar no es lindo pero es una muy buena opción para dormir en Merida. Esta cerca del teleférico.

name: Agua el Toro
description:
Filtered water .
10 Bolivares for 20 litros.

name: Mt Roraima tours
description:
We rode to this village and asked around for tours to hike mt Roraima (you can't go by yourself) 
For 50$ a day each (we were a group of three) we got a guide and porters, but we only wanted to arrive to the base camp (three days). The prices included the entrance to the park but not the food. Also you need your camping gear. 
There are A LOT of midges so wear long sleeved  trousers and shirts and if you have it bring a head net, they were a nightmare

name: COTATUR. Corporación Tachirense de Turismo
description:
It is an establishment that has a closed parking lot and a small open one, which they provide for overnight stays with bathroom service, WiFi, electricity, a lounge, and tourist police. We spent a very quiet night, it is a good location and the staff is very attentive. It can be used as a base to explore what is in the area.
.....
Es un establecimiento que cuenta con estacionamiento cerrado y uno pequeño abierto, que prestan para pernoctar con servicio de baño, WiFi, electricidad, un salón y policía turística. Pasamos una noche muy tranquila, tiene buena ubicación y el personal muy atento. Se puede usar como base para recorrer lo que hay en la zona.

name: Vitmina
description:
Vitmina Belen. Best typical drink in Merida .“Vitamina” Vitamin and the ice creams are homemade and very delicious!

———-

Lugar típico de Merida que vende la bebida Vitamina es muy rica, el helado es artesanal y son muy buenos!

name: Hotel Belen Plaza
description:
Hotel Belen Plaza, very nice hotel with large parking without size restriction. Its owners are very friendly. From here you can take many tours through the towns in the South of Merida, Roldán, the owner of the hotel, has many 4x4 trucks to take tours around the area! It is possible to take the tours without staying at the hotel! The price of a double room is 25 dollars, you can also sleep in the camper in the parking lot for 5 dollars. 
Highly recommended.
+58 04247184785
————

Hotel Belen Plaza, muy lindo hotel con gran parking sin restricción de tamaño. Sus dueños son muy amables. Desde aquí se puede realizar muchos tours por los pueblos del Sur de Merida, Roldán el dueño del hotel tiene muchas camionetas 4x4 para realizar los tours por la zona! Es posible realizar los tours sin alojarse en el hotel! 
La habitación doble cuesta 25 dólares, también se puede dormir en el camper en el estacionamiento por 5 dólares. 
Muy recomendado 
+58 04247184785v

name: Tours - Southern Towns Merida
description:
Hotel Belen Plaza, very nice hotel with large parking without size restriction. Its owners are very friendly. From here you can take many tours through the towns in the South of Merida, Roldán, the owner of the hotel, has many 4x4 trucks to take tours around the area! It is possible to take the tours without staying at the hotel! highly recommended
————
Hotel Belen Plaza, muy lindo hotel con gran parking sin restricción de tamaño. Sus dueños son muy amables. Desde aquí se puede realizar muchos tours por los pueblos del Sur de Merida, Roldán el dueño del hotel tiene muchas camionetas 4x4 para realizar los tours por la zona! Es posible realizar los tours sin alojarse en el hotel! muy recomendado

name: Parking at Belen Plaza Hotel
description:
Large parking with no size restriction, it is at the Belen Plaza Hotel. The cost is $5 per night per camper. 
From the Hotel you can take tours to the towns of the South, Roldan, the owner, knows the towns of the South very well and takes you in his 4x4 trucks.

————-

Parking sin restricción de tamaño, es del Hotel Belen Plaza. El costo es de 5 dólares la noche por camper. Desde el Hotel se pueden realizar los tours hacia los pueblos del Sur, Roldan su dueño conoce muy bien los pueblos y te lleva en sus camionetas 4x4.

name: Centro Histórico de Coro
description: This city is a human patron by UNESCO. The history is beautiful and amazing. This place is very important and you should stop here!

name: Jaime Hospedaje
description:
Very good place, with kitchen, place to park, set up tent, and park vans. Jaime can get you fuel (gasoline), and everything you need. He was very helpful with me. Ask him to show you places nearby, very nice tour!!
Don't forget to tell him you found him by this app!!

His phone! WhatsApp too:
+58 414-3821505

name: Square in Mucuchies
description:
We spent a night in the square on Saturday, it is a bit crowded with the townspeople. We feel very safe. Surely during the week it is quieter.
In the square there is free internet but very slow

————-

Nos quedamos una noche en la plaza el día sábado, es un poco concurrida por la gente del pueblo. Nos sentimos muy seguros. 
Seguramente entre semana es más tranquilo. 
Hay internet en la plaza pero muy lento

name: Parking close Termales La Musui
description:
Parking that is 40 meters from the entrance to La Musui hot springs. We spent two nights here, it costs 3 dollars per night. The place is very quiet and safe. The road is uphill but is in good condition. There is drinking water and toilet.

———

Estacionamiento que está a 40 metros de la entrada a las aguas termales La Musui. Nos quedamos dos noche aquí, sale 3 dólares por noche. El lugar es muy tranquilo y seguro. El camino es en subida bastante pronunciada, pero esta en buen estado. Hay agua potable y baño. 
El wifi de la oficina de las termas llega al lugar, muy lento.

name: Beautiful Termales La Musui
description:
Beautiful natural hot springs, the entrance costs 3 dollars per person, to get there you walk 45 minutes. I recommend arriving early in the morning to enjoy them without people. You can get to where the trekking begins by vehicle and the route to get there is a big climb but in good condition.

————

Hermosas aguas termales naturales, la entrada sale 3 dólares por persona, para llegar se camina 45 minutos. recomiendo llegar temprano en la mañana para disfrutarlas sin gente. Se puede llegar en vehículo hasta donde empieza el trekking y la ruta para llegar es una subida grande pero en buen estado.

name: Rally garaje - offroadmarco
description:
Marco good mechanic! For motorcycles and if you need sth for trucks/cars he will help you!

His wpp, if you talk tell him you come from the app, you are a traveler
+58 414-1801413

name: Pizzeria kanzler
description:
Good pizza in tovar, and the “pasticho” for me is better haha, try it!  Very sweet people will recibe us!
+58 412-9903488
Tell them you find it by this app!

name: Panadería Café Oimira
description: Good coffee and products at this place. Friendly service. Average WiFi.

name: Natural Pool
description:
You can either hike down the river from the watercrossing on the road or take a little path behind the corner of the road in direction of El Pauji.
It's a beautiful natural pool to cool off directly under a waterfall.
You will most likely have the place to yourself.

name: Hotel Neptuno
description: Got a room for 15$ with AC and cold shower. Room has view on Paseo Colón. The quality is pretty bad but I couldn't find cheaper. I think for the price, considering the location, it's not that bad.

name: Hotel Hostería Waipá
description:
We are a family hotel, which provides support to travelers and motorcycle travelers. We belong to the Motera community of Puerto Ordaz
----------
Somos un hotel familiar, que presta apoyo a viajeros y moto viajeros. Pertenecemos a la comunidad Motera de Puerto Ordaz

name: GPL/LPG filling station
description: Large filling station for GPL/LPG. If you have portable bottles, they fill it while you wait. If you have a fixed tank, they will let you in and fill you from the truck(if it’s there). Make sure you have the correct adapter, the truck has an ACME connection. Super friendly! Price was about 0,25$us/l

name: Recarga de Gas
description: It was possible to recharge the gas cylinder from Brazil and Chile, I have my own adapters.

name: Water tap
description:
There is a water tap to fill the camper's tank. you can connect a hose

Hay un grifo de agua disponible en el parking con fácil acceso, se puede conectar una manguera para llenar el tanque de la camper. No estoy seguro que sea potable

name: Indigenous Checkpoint
description:
This is the 3rd Checkpoint on the way to El Pauji. They asked us for a permiso that we should have organized before going to El Pauji. Other travellers have not been asked for the permiso but the locals said that officially you need a permiso.
They let us through because we had a contact and a name where we wanted to stay.
Just to be safe I would recommend contacting someone in El Pauji, for example Brisas del Pauji, to get you a permiso. They will all be happy to help you.

name: Clínica Veterinaria Dr. Luis Riobueno
description:
In our opinion a very good Veterinary. Our dog was very sick and he diagnosed ehrlichiosis. He immediately had started with the antibiotic treatment and was very caring.
There is another Veterinary called Ronniel in Santa Elena. We do not recommend him. We went there first and he not only had a wrong diagnosis but gave the dog medication that made the symptoms worse. 



Some of the medications needed were only available in Pacaraima but you can just cross the border without stamping out and in. VETAGRO is a very good place in Pacaraima where they have everything the dog needs.

You can contact Dr. Riobueno via Whattsapp. He has a Brazilian number. +559293825200

name: Posada San Rafael
description:
We paid 25$ for a room for 3 people, quite big and very nice and clean. No heating (not sure many places have it anyway around here) but they give you a lot of warm blankets. There is WiFi and hot water but there is no electricity in the village in the afternoon till 6pm. 
Secure parking space.

name: Posada Los Próceres
description:
We paid $12 for a matrimonial with private bathroom, simple but seemed clean. There is parking space in the front but you can also leave your vehicle in a secure parking just next door (for free) 
The town centre is around 20 minutes walk, the area seemed safe. There is a kitchen you can use but it was a bit messy when we were there. The guy at the reception was very friendly and kind. WiFi is terrible.

name: Money Exchange Black Market
description:
Here you can change Dollars into Reais.
The people that change the money are sitting at every corner of the intersection. Most likely they will shout "cambio" once you walk pass them. We got a rate of 4,8 Reais per dollar while the official rate was 5,0 Reais per dollar. 
It does not feel dodgy there, so don't be afraid to change your money on the street. It's your only option, anyway. 

We got this place recommended by Luis from Cabañas Friedenau. 

In the south of the Gran Sabana the Brazilian Real is the main currency. It is way easier to pay in Reais than Dollars.
If you are lucky they might change your big dollar notes into smaller ones, as well.

name: Playa Castillo
description: Right next to the fort is playa Castillo, a small sandy beach. Houses nearby but friendly people, no problem to overnight.

name: Palmeras en la Nieve - Casa de Playa
description: Paradisic place a few meters from the beach. Plenty of parking space, running water, electricity, kitchen, wifi.

name: Ciudad Vacacional - Los Caracas
description:
“Vacation city Los Caracas” Camping in very good condition, next to the beach, ideal for camping for several days. 
We spent three nights very calm and safe. 
24 hour security. The color of the ocean water is incredible, ideal for surfing. 
There is water, toilets and showers. We paid 5 dollars per night for two people and our Motorhome. Beautiful place.
————
“Ciudad vacacional Los Caracas” Camping en muy buenas condiciones, al lado de la playa, ideal para acampar varios días. Estuvimos tres noches muy tranquilo y seguro. Hay seguridad las 24horas. El color del agua del océano es increíble, ideal para surfear. Hay agua, baños y duchas. Pagamos 5 dólares por noche para dos personas y nuestra Motorhome. Hermoso lugar.

name: Jose Labrador Place
description:
Jose helps the network of international travelers in Venezuela  (Ig @viajero.ve). At his place, you can park your car or motorhome safely, he can provide you some basic services such as WiFi, toilets, water and help you for anything you need. WhatsApp +584121294418
.....
El amigo Jose es colaborador de la RED de viajeros internacionales en Venezuela Ig @viajero.ve , Su casa es un lugar seguro donde pueden estacionar su auto Caravana con seguridad el puede facilitar WIFI, ducha, agua y ayudarlo en cualquier cosa q necesiten su contacto de WS +584121294418

name: Parque Nacional
description: At the entrance of the P/N Avila is this parkingspot/mirador where one can overnight. Probably one of the most secure spots in Caracas as there is a permanent office of the guardaparques and a checkpoint of guardia nacional in front. Just a few minutes (by car) from the city center. Very quiet at night, clean fresh air. NOT for big rigs. The access road is steep, and to enter the road you can either take the illegal sideroad directly from the highway (recommended) or follow your gps which will lead you trough some small streets to get to the tunnel under the highway. Possibilities for hiking. You can drive all the way up the mountain to the top of the teleferico in Galipan, but 4x4 only (asphalt road, but you need low gear for the long >20deg ascent). To be able to stay here, you will need to register with the guardaparques, overly bureaucratic, but be very friendly to them so they keep allowing people to stay here :-)

name: Piedra del Elefante
description:
Campspot at the Piedra del Elefante. Good and safe for a night or two. The locals seem to use the Piedra for some offroading but definitely quiet during the week.
You can also go for a hike to the water and have a bath.
There's probably good mobile reception on top of the Piedra.

name: La Fontana Panetteria
description: Good coffee with good WiFi, car parked in front, good service.

name: Near center
description: Public parking area right in the middle of town, might be busy during weekends but during the week it is nearly empty. Had a very quiet night here. We asked at the restaurant if it is ok to overnight here and they said it is no problem.

name: Diesel E/S Colonia Tovar
description: They have diesel here, but in limited quantities. They are friendly and helpful. We got 60 liters here for the normal price.

name: Potable Water Zoological Garden
description:
If you don't spend the night in the Zoological Garden anyway, you can still come here and fill up you lr water. All the locals come here to get their drinking water. It is completely clean and perfect for consumption.
The site opens at around 8am.

name: Monumento Virgen Del Valle
description:
Here you are, a big white Virgen with a crown on top, surrounded by simbolized blue waves of the Delta Amacuro.
Not worth a detour, but right in the middle of the roundabout.

name: hotel de maluco
description:
a good place to rest and has wi-fi, cold water and bathroom. It's really worth staying here.
um bom lugar para descansar e tem wi-fi, água gelada e banheiro. vale muito apena ficar aqui.

name: Valera diesel
description: Big filling station that sells diesel. Large waiting line, but they let you skip it, but you pay more for your diesel

name: Las arepas de Margaret
description:
This is a very famous arepera with great price/quality rate. So even if you're not a fan of arepas, I'd strobgly recommend to give it a try.
Their speciality are arepas with shrimp salad and squid stew, $3.5 for one. There also a lot of other flavors, for a lower price. The portions are descent (check the pics).
Be prepared for a long line if you go on weekends. Closed on Mondays.

name: Cacao Tour Paria
description:
Nice little tour on an organic Cacao farm. Takes around 45 minutes and you see the plantation, the processing and a nice little movie about the region in the end.
Costs only 2$ per person and you can buy the chocolate in the end for 2-3$ per block.
We didn't ask but I am pretty sure they would let you camp there for the night. They have toilets and showers.

We would absolutely recommend the tour as it is inexpensive and you support the local economy.

name: Amplio terreno
description:
Where the trucks park to spend the night next to the road. Very safe because there is the police on one side and the national guard on the other. The guard at the Bosco logging company offers you a bucket to take a shower if you want.
---
Donde estacionan los camiones para pernoctar al lado de la ruta. Muy seguro porque está la policia de un lado y la guardia nacional del otro. El guardia de la empresa maderera Bosco te ofrece un balde para ducharte si queres.

name: No road - Don't follow Google Maps
description:
Google maps and Maps.me told us to take this road to Playa Medina/Chaguaramas. Do not take this road. It is only a path for motos. No space to turn around, so you will have to reverse all the way.
Some locals came to us and said it's possible by 4x4 so we tackled the road with our Landcruiser. But it will save you some nerves and a lot of time if you just take the right way via Agua Dulce.

name: Purificadora - potable Water
description:
At this place there is a Purificadora where you can fill up bottles/Jerry cans, etc. We filled up around 80 liters for 1$ (35 Bolívares).
It is in the middle of town on a busy road, so access with a big rig might be difficult.
We saw a couple more purificadoras in this road.

name: Baseball Stadium
description:
We spent 3 nights here. Very quiet place and we felt safe. It is well located, near Playa Grande and the Malecón. The first night the police visited us and left us the phone number for any inconvenience. It has no facilities. We recommend. 
_______

Nos quedamos 3 noches. Lugar muy tranquilo y nos sentimos seguros. esta bien ubicado, cerca de playa grande y del malecón. la primera noche nos visitó la policía y nos dejó su número de teléfono por cualquier inconveniente. no tiene facilidades. recomendamos.

name: Playa La Punta
description:
We spent 3 nights here, quiet and safe place. It is in the parking lot of La Punta beach. It is ideal to leave the Camper and go to the Cienaga. Eduardo is on-site, he rents umbrellas and chairs on the beach, he is very friendly and helpful, his WhatsApp is +58 4128741265. He can check the vehicles. There are no facilities. It's very quiet on the weekends

——

Nos quedamos 3 noches aquí, lugar tranquilo y seguro. es en el estacionamiento de la playa La Punta. Es ideal para dejar la Camper e ir a la Cienaga. En el sitio se encuentra Eduardo, el alquila sombrillas y sillas en la playa, el es muy amable y servicial su WhatsApp es +58 4128741265. Dejamos el vehículo aquí y fuimos a La Ciénaga, Eduardo lo cuidó. 
No hay facilidades. Es muy tranquilo los fines de semana

name: Abandoned hotels at Playa Mata Gorda
description: Nice place for camping. No facilities. It is safe. We stayed one week here! Nice people arround.

name: Embalse dos cerritos
description:
Beautiful and quiet place on the banks of the reservoir. Save place to make a fire, bathrooms. Very highly recommended

Lugar hermoso y tranquilo a orillas del embalse. seguridad, lugar para hacer fuego, baños. muy muy recomendado

name: cascada del vino
description:
We spent the night at the ranger station with our RV. Down at the waterfall camping is allowed, but the descent is very steep. Free to camp, park admission is $1 per person.

pasamos la noche en la estación de guardaparques con nuestro mh. abajo en la cascada se permite acampar pero la bajada es muy pronunciada. Gratis para acampar, la entrada al parque es de 1 dólar por persona.

name: Street next to the Virgin of Peace
description:
Safe place to sleep, has surveillance, very quiet, there is Wi-Fi.
The road to get there is paved, but it is steep, it can be done with a 2x2 vehicle.

lugar seguro para dormir, cuenta con vigilancia, muy silencioso, hay wifi.
el camino para llegar es pavimentado pero tiene mucha subida, se puede hacer con vehículo 2x2

name: E/S Caribe
description: Diesel Available, easy access and they work at night too

name: Calle del hambre
description:
Many arepa street places to eat anytime at night after a party.
Not the best quality but quite good

name: Diesel availabe
description: We could fill up 50l of diesel here. No waiting time and 50 cents/liter. There was a line of cars waiting for Gasoline but the diesel pump was free.

name: Planetário y Parque Las Peonias
description:
Ample, level and safe parking at the Mara Planetarium, excellent for spending the night, super friendly people.
------------
Estacionamento amplo, nivelado e seguro no planetário de Mara, excelente para passar a noite, pessoas super amáveis.

name: Taller Los Castros - Experto VW / General 4x4
description:
We arrived here on the recommendation of friends we know who have a VW here in Maracaibo and we came to do a general overhaul on the engine of our 2005 Kombi. Small but super complete workshop, it has all the equipment to clean the injectors and measure the compression, really very good The service staff are super experienced and knowledgeable.  I recommend. Sr. Heberto Castro +58 424 628 6249

Chegamos aqui por indicação dos amigos que conhecemos que tem VW aqui em Maracaibo e viemos fazer uma revisão geral no motor da nossa Kombi 2005. Oficina pequena mas super completa, tem todos os equipamentos para fazer limpeza dos injetores e medimos a compressão, realmente muito bom o atendimento são super experientes e conhecedores. Super recomendo.Sr. Heberto Castro +58 424 628 6249

name: Bueno va - Potable water
description: drinking water, it has a lot of power. ideal for filling the water tank! Is free.

name: Possada La Romereńa
description: Friendly possada with magnificent views. They have rooms (I think 20 us$), but you can stay for free (for now?)in the parking lot. There is also a second grassy parking lot, but sometimes they run a generator there. You can use the kitchen/dining room with spectacular views. Water tap available for tanks.

name: Public Parking
description:
Public parking we spent two nights here, quiet and safe place to stop during the day or spend the night. Good location, in the historic center, Square Simón Bolívar and close to Playa Sonrisa. 
Catania Supermarket 400 meters away. There are no facilities. 
In front there is a cafe that has very good wifi,.
Recommended.
———
Parking público estuvimos dos noches aquí,lugar tranquilo y seguro para parar en el día o la noche. buena ubicación, en el centro histórico, plaza Simón Bolívar y cerca de Playa sonrisas. Supermecado Catania a 400mts. 
El café que está al frente tiene muy buen wifi y cafés, la señal llega al estacionamiento. (Wifi V.I.P - Carabobo10K.)
No hay servicios. Recomendado.

name: Carbon y Palos
description:
Carbon y Palos is a rural and family restaurant. It has room to serve travelers in spectacular nature.
You have water, there are toilets.
It is for vehicles up to a height of 4.3m and a length of approximately 8m.
Mariana and Pedro are wonderful people and help as much as they can.
the price is $5 a night
Carbon y Palos es un restaurante rural y familiar. Tiene sitio para atender viajeros en una naturaleza espectacular.
tienes agua, hay aseos.
Es para vehiculos hasta una altura de 4.3m y una longitud de 8m aprox.
Mariana y Pedro son unos unas personas maravillosos y ayudan en lo que pueden.
el precio es de 5 $ la noche

name: Água potável
description: Here they sell 60lt drinking water for 1USD (3 x 20lt bottles) you can also ask for non-potable water to connect the hose and fill the tanks. —— aquí venden agua potable 60lt x 1USD (3 botellas de 20lt) también pueden preguntar por agua no potable para conectar la manguera y llenar los tanques de la camper

name: Lavanderia Gisselle
description:
Translation: Laundry by the kilo.
Good fast and good service.
We brought the clothes in the morning and picked them up at noon.

Lavanderia por kilos.
Rapido bueno y buen servicio.
Hemos traido la ropa por la mañana y la hemos recogido por mediodía.

name: Evergreen II
description:
This restaurant offers Taiwanese vegetarian food by weight, $7 for a kg.
I'm not a vegetarian at all, but just loved this place and ate various times here while staying in Maracay. The variation of food is really wide and the bang for a buck is hard to beat. My personal favorite is banana lasagna. The drinks, like fresh juices, are also very good.

The restaurant has more than 10 years old,  so it's quite likely it's still open while you're reading this.

name: Karina y Franklin house
description:
Karina, Franklin and José are part of the traveler support group and receive a motorhome in front of their house to spend the night.  Super quiet, safe neighborhood, in front of a small square, with space and level to park without problems.  A very welcoming family, we spent hours talking, without noticing the time passing.

Karina, Franklin e José fazem parte do grupo de apoio a viajantes e recebem motorhome em frente a sua casa para passar a noite. Bairro super tranquilo, seguro, em frente a uma pracinha, com espaço e nivelado para estacionar sem problemas. Uma família muito acolhedora, ficamos horas conversando, sem perceber o tempo passar.

name: PDV Coro
description:
We were able to refill here, for 0.50 dollars per liter.

Conseguimos reabastecer aqui, 0,50 de dólar o litro.

name: Cabo San Roman
description:
We arrived here in the afternoon to watch the sunset and there was a storm, so we decided to stay and wait it out. There are two roads up to here, the first (Google maps route) is only enabled for 4x4, we tried it with our VW Kombi and couldn't make it. We returned to the main road and drove a few more minutes to the second (blue) sign indicating the entrance to a road in better condition. It's quite windy and there's no cell phone signal, but we felt very safe. It was a very peaceful night and the sunrise is beautiful.

---

Chegamos aqui a tarde para ver o por do sol e  caiu uma tempestade, decidimos ficar e esperar passar. São duas estradas até aqui, a primeira (rota do Google maps) está habilitada apenas para 4x4, nós tentamos com nossa VW Kombi e não conseguimos. Voltamos até a estrada principal e dirigimos mais alguns minutos até a segunda placa (azul) que indica a entrada por uma estrada em melhores condições. Venta bastante e não tem sinal de celular, mas nos sentimos super seguros. Foi uma noite muito tranquila e o nascer do sol é lindo.

name: Impassable Road to Cabo San Roman
description:
The mapping apps will  send you along this "Via Cabo San Roman", which is a 4x4 only track, with very uneven stretches of soft sand and some parts with uneven stones. But there are two roads with that name (on Google): this one (the eastern one) is impassable for most vehicles and will lead to long delays or damage to non-4x4 vehicles.

While we were in the area, three tourist vehicles got bogged down, which is why I marked this as dangerous, because if a motorhome tries to pass there it will have problems. There is a tourist attraction marked in iOverlander with the correct entrance.

We didn't cross this road to Cabo San Roman with our VW. Only 4x4. Five minutes to the west is another entrance (12.18066, -69.99676) so much better for all cars.

Não venha por esse caminho, a estrada é de areia fofa, nós não conseguimos passar. A entrada correta do caminho até o Farol Cabo San Roman é cinco minutos adiante numa placa azul.

name: Laguna Brava
description: Peaceful lake high up in the mountains. Beautiful surroundings. Pretty steep (and long) climb from the valley floor, but all asphalt except the last few km (which are flat).

name: E/S Internacional
description: This one is “public”, the other station a few hundred meters away is only for government use. In both stations everything is possible if you ask nicely … Both have diesel and gasoline (sometimes)

name: Church Parking Lot
description: We spent 2 nights here, a quiet, safe and illuminated place. The place is in the back of the church. The police are 50 meters away. There are no facilities. Good place

name: Posada Bolivar
description: This is the place of the lovely Familia Bolivar. We spent our second night in Venezuela here. Very safe. They provide toilet and showers, you also can fill your water tank with filtered water. WiFi possible. And you get a lot of information and make new friends. totally recommended

name: Supermercado Garzon
description: Here you can fill up your groceries. You can pay by credit card.

name: CLUB CAMPESTRE LA LLOVIZNA
description: This beautiful place is run by a very nice welcoming family. You find space for any rig or tent under the shade of huge trees. The pools are cristal clear and the playground is super nice. They also have horses, pigs, chicken, dogs and cats. They are very helpful with anything, also if you need gasolina or diesel. Toilets are in good condition and clean. They have an own Zip-line on the property and you also can catch a fresh fish from their own fish pond. Highly recommended! WhatsApp Leonardo +58 4247382870

name: Military checkpoint
description: They did not wanted to see any documents, Just intersted in our Truck and invited us for a coffee.

name: Concha Farm
description: We stayed here for the night on this farm in our Truck. It was a emergency overnight Stop for us because the night was coming. Was a little hassle to find somebody to get a permission. We didnt wanted to stay in Concha town. People were very friendly, a little astonished about our Military looking Truck, but than they invited us to super fresh milk. It was free. ok Movistar signal

name: PDV
description:
We can fuel the tank here, $0,50 per liter

conseguimos abastecer aqui por $0,50 o litro

name: PDVSA gas station
description:
POS gas station, we only waited 20 minutes in line to fill up, gas $0.50 per liter.
---
Posto de gasolina PDV, esperamos apenas 20 minutos na fila para abastecer, gasolina $0,50 por litro.

name: Mirador for Catatumbo lights
description: From this mirador you can see the catatumbo spectacle. Unfortunately we saw nothing, locals told us it just takes place from June till September.

name: Bodegón Residencial Fernendez
description:
Larry and his family welcomed me in his amazing residences in tucupita. It felt like family staying for a few days waiting for my ferry to Trinidad.
There is everything you need. A nice room with AC nice shower, a garden, full equipped kitchen. It is safe and if you require anything you can buy it in their little shop in front.
I paid 20$ for a private room
They say you can also camp if you want to.
They have all the contacts for the ferry's to Trinidad. 

Contact them on whatsapp +58 416 238 74 99

name: Posada Quinta Guadalupe
description:
Nice little hotel in Valera. Reception 24h! Safe parking space for cars and motorcycles (no big rigs). Everything exceptional clean! We payed 25USD for a matrimonial with AC. Great hot shower!
Wifi is included in the price, works fine but sometimes a little slow. They also have a big kitchen area (everything you need) - just bring your own food! Laundry is available. Nearby in walking distance are a few restaurants. 
They offer potable water. 
We highly recommend it!

name: Posada El Rancho La Azulita
description: This is THE PLACE to BE in this area! We came here to see the Catatumbo lights and it was so fantastic. You can stay here in this beautiful place in your truck, van or in a tent, or rent one of the beautiful rooms. Beautiful communal kitchen, living area and very clean bathrooms with hot showers! The buildings are fantastic and in the huge garden you can see toucans and hummingbirds. price for staying in your car and tent is 10$ per night, staying in a room is 10$ per person. The owners are very welcoming and help you with everything. They also brought us to the town to see the Catatumbo spectacle for a small amount. The climate here is fantastic, warm in day, cool in the night. You also can bathe in the river! Totally recommended!!! WhatsApp+58 4160582930

name: Hotel Parking El Conde
description:
Hotel with perfect parking for motorhomes, close to supermarkets, pharmacies and shops in general.  Depending on the season, the parking lot may be full so you need to get in touch in advance to confirm availability.  Rooms with air conditioning and bathroom, excellent for a night's rest.  The owner Jonathan is super attentive and welcomed us very well, I highly recommend him!
--
Hotel com estacionamento perfeito para motorhome, próximo de supermercado, farmácia e comércio em geral. Dependendo da época, o estacionamento pode estar lotado então é necessário entrar em contato antes para confirmar a disponibilidade. Quartos com ar condicionado e banheiro, excelente para uma noite de descanso. O proprietário Jonathan é super atencioso e nos recebeu muito bem, recomendo muito!

name: Teleferico
description: Here is the entrance to the teleferico. Paid 37US$ pp

name: Estasionamente/Parking
description: Here we stayed the night in our Truck. The guy wanted to have 10$, we gave 5$. Its definitely not a nice place but the plaza was full of people. The place is secured by an unfriendly Dog and it was very quiet at night.Good 4g Movistar signal

name: Observatorium Cida
description: Here is an Observatorio. We could not visit it because of Renovation, Bit they told us it will be reopened end of december 2023

name: La seguridad R.C.V
description: Here you can get the medical card, mandatory for driving in the country (is 30.000 pesos colombianos) and also you can get the vehicle insurance. they also make copies.

name: Casa de Yasmel
description: We stayed here in our truck at the private property of Yasmin and her Family. It was very spontanous that she invited us. We met her at the sports field nearby where we searched for an overnight place. She just said come to my house and came in our Truck to Go to her House! Very friendly people. Gave her 5$  and we had a very quiet night. 4G Movistar signal

name: Expresos Burguer Maracay
description:
Wonderful restaurant in Maracay, I recommend picanha hamburger and Ensalada Cesar, they are delicious, average price $7 dollars @expresosburguer
---
Restaurante maravilhoso em Maracay, recomendo hambúrguesa de picanha e Ensalada Cesar, são deliciosas, preço médio $7 dólares @expresosburguer

name: CACHAPAS El Sabor Andino
description: Here you can eat a delicious Cachapas. Miguel, the owner is so gentile and kind. Come over, eat and have a chat! You don't regret it.

name: Gasoil
description: Here we could fill up our diesel tank!

name: Bar Restaurante Gran Oasis
description: Good place for overnight stay! Friendly family, let is stay for the night for 10$

name: between sports fields
description: big parking, very quiet, sb came round and said: no problem. nothing to complain, good stop between big towns.

name: Mecanico Hernán (Kombi y Escarabajo)
description:
Mechanic specializing in Volkswagen Combi and Beetle, really competent. If you have a noise that you don't know where it comes from, he knows for sure.
It’s open from Monday to Saturday, but it’s better to call Hernán before. 
+ 58 412 723 2095

name: Hospedaje Minina
description:
Great place to stay, quiet. Good owners, very helpful!
You can buy wifi, and works good.

name: Diesel PDV
description: Here we were able to fill our tank with Diesel

name: Bahía de Patanemo
description:
Here you will find a beautiful long beach with a few restaurants and shade on the beach on weekends. Safe to swim but lots of waves. You can park with a sea view where "guards" will ask for a couple of dollars for parking or there's lots of space further back from the beach under palm trees. Space for all forms of camping. There is a bathroom that costs 10bls. On the right after entering, there is an area with several grills if you want to cook over a fire. At the entrance to the area they can charge 70bls per car. After 5pm there was no one to collect this fee but the gate was open.
Busy on weekends, deserted on a weeknight

Very nice place to stay for a few days. Bring food and water because there are only restaurants nearby (the town is more than 1 km away).
Good Movistar signal.
--
lugar para parqueo justo antes de los restaurantes, a la derecha del camino. se puede acampar o poner hamacas. hay baño q cuesta 10bls. está el mar en frente y el río muy cerca. En la entrada si hay alguien pueden cobrar 70bls x auto. Cierra el ingreso a las 17hs (no sé si se puede ingresar desp de esa hora)
se sintió seguro y muy tranquilo por la noche y en la semana, los fines de semana se llena de gente.
El camino de puerto cabello hasta acá tiene algunas subidas y muchas curvas cerradas pero nosotros las hicimos en un kombi y no hubo mayor problema. Recomendamos hacerlas fuera de "hora pico" xq hay zonas angostas de una sola vía.
Muy lindo lugar para quedarse unos días. Traer víveres y agua xq acá solo hay restaurantes cerca (el pueblo está a más de 1 km)

name: peaje parking
description: we asked to park here and the people that works in the toll both let us stay for the night, very very friendly staff. We could park right after the toll, going towards penisula the Coro, very safe, there are toilets and Wi-Fi here and offered us to fill our water tank.

name: PDV with diesel
description: We found diesel in this petrol station. They also have Gasolina.

name: Hotel La Roca
description:
Hotel near the old town, comfortable and clean, with good Wi-Fi, A/C, and secure enclosed parking. $30 USD per night for a triple room. Friendly and attentive staff. 
The manager, Mr. Israel, is a wonderful person and provides recommendations for exploring the city. We spent two nights here, the second one complimentary, and they even helped us find gasoline.
---
Hotel cerca del casco antiguo, cómodo y limpio, con buen wifi, a/c, y estacionamiento cerrado y seguro.
US $30 dlls. habitación triple. Personal amable y atento. 
El gerente don Israel es una gran persona y te da recomendaciones para conocer la ciudad. Pasamos dos noches aquí, la segunda de cortesía y además nos consiguieron gasolina.

name: Playa Patanema
description: Great spot close to the beach, we stayed here 4 days over Christmas together with other overlanders. Normally 5$ parking fee, was nobody there when we arrived. very quiet at night. Good 4g Movistar reception

name: Lubricantes Quintero Silva
description:
Oil for all types of vehicles, Mastercard credit card accepted
---
Aceites para todos os tipos de veículos, aceitam cartão de crédito Mastercard

name: Forum Super Mayorista
description:
Good supermarket, easy spot in town, heigh parking lot and payments credit card available. 
---
Supermercado grande, bons preços, localização de fácil acesso, estacionamento externo sem limite de altura, aceitam cartão de crédito.

name: Canarias Suite
description:
It's a stopover hotel with the option to spend the night, at $30 USD for a room with two beds. It includes Wi-Fi, A/C, and spacious, secure parking. The staff is friendly

Es un hotel de paso con posibilidad de pasar la noche, us $30 dlls. Habitación con dos camas.
Wifi, a/c, estacionamiento amplio y seguro. Personal amable.
Un motorhome seguro puede acceder porque hay un portón para camiones, sin embargo no estoy seguro si permitan pasar la noche en el o deba ser forzosamente rentando una habitación.

name: Posada los pinos - backpakers
description:
You can put your tent, or rent a room, 
very nice and quiet , has pool also.
I pay 15usd per night for the room.

name: PDV
description:
good gas station without queues great option
bom posto pra abastecer sem filas ótima opção

name: PDV Boca de Uchire
description:
We managed to get gas here, there was a queue of about 11 cars and the next 2 behind were the last, they ran out of gas. We waited in line for 40 minutes and it ended around 1pm
Conseguimos abastecer aqui, tinha fila de uns 11 carros e os próximos 2 de trás foram os últimos, acabou a gasolina. Ficamos 40 minutos na fila e acabou por volta de 13h

name: cuyagua's gate
description: there is an entrance here where they asked us for 5 dollars, we didn't know that we had to pay to enter. We asked and the girl said it is only on weekends (Friday, Saturday,  Sunday) during the week is free....

name: Buonaventura Grill
description:
Excellent restaurant with a wide variety of food, pasta, meat, regional food. Good prices (arepas, empanadas, cachapa between 3 and 7 USD, more elaborate dishes around 12 USD, enough portions to share) very attentive service, we simply loved it. We ordered Cachapa with cheese and everything was wonderful.
Restaurante excelente com grande variedade de comida, massas, carnes, comida regional. Bons preços (arepas, empanadas, cachapa entre 3 e 7 usd, pratos mais elaborados cerca de 12 usd, porções suficientes para compartilhar) atendimento muito atencioso, simplesmente adoramos. Pedimos Cachapa com queijo e estava tudo maravilhoso.

name: Hiper Lider Barcelona
description:
Large supermarket with great prices and ample outdoor parking with no height limit and super easy access at the entrance to Barcelona.
Supermercado grande com ótimos preços e amplo estacionamento externo sem limite de altura e de super fácil acesso na entrada de Barcelona.

name: policial check
description: We passed by this policing check and asked if we could park and sleep here, as it was late, the guard let us stay in front of the check-point and said they would be there all night long. We felt safe, very quiet, we asked for the wifi password and he gave us.

name: Playa Cuyagua West
description:
Best place ever! stayed here over new years Eve for 5 nights. Restaurants were open with food, drinks, toilets and showers.
many locals with roof top tents and music playing.
Felt very safe, nice people around. Weak Movistar signal

name: Grassy spot next to restaurant
description: Big grassy parking next to restaurant (no one there on Thursday evening) and next to the road. Difficult to find a flat space in this mountainous area. Quiet at night. Nothing special.

name: Monasterio Trapense
description: Very warm welcome by the brothers. They have their own coffee plantation and they are happy to show you around. You can buy coffee of extremely good quality.  Stayed one night at this extremely peaceful spot with breathtaking views. Don't miss the prayers. Their singing is very beautiful!

name: bushcamp
description: It's not easy to find a bushcamp on the route of the pueblos del sur. Here is a place where it is possible on top of the mountain. Slightly visible from the road.  Often fog. Large open space next to the road or follow the path for 50 meters (what we did) and there is another smaller spot. Quiet night and nice views when the fog disappears.

name: bushcamp next to paragliders take-off site
description: Several paragliders in action on Sunday evening. You can see Mérida in the distance. Very quiet night. Nice place with beautiful views. No facilities. Also accessible without 4x4.

name: Super Pets Veterinário
description:
Excellent veterinary clinic, we found it by chance and took our poodle for an appointment that we were already looking for. The service is quick, the veterinarian is very attentive, super professional, the prices are good, including medicines.

Excelente clínica veterinária, encontramos por acaso passando e levamos nossa poodle para uma consulta que já estávamos buscando. O atendimento é rápido, o veterinário muito atencioso, super profissional, os preços são bons inclusive dos medicamentos.

name: Hotel FREIBURG Parking lot
description: We stayed here 3 nights behind the parking lot of Hotel Freiburg. The owner Jürgen (speaks Spanisch and German) is very friendly and helpful. We got access to a room for toilet and hot shower, also offered us 220V electricity. You can make a nice walk to the center in 20 minutes Paid 10$ pn, totally worth.

name: Rio Supermarket
description:
The best supermarket we found in Venezuela, huge variety of products and good prices, ample outdoor parking, the only problem is the height limit, it must be around 2.40 to get past the gate, the rest is open.
---------
O melhor supermercado que encontramos na Venezuela, variedade enorme de produtos e preços bons, estacionamento externo e amplo, o único porém é o limite de altura, deve ser pra volta de 2,40 pra passar do portão, o restante é aberto.

name: E\S El Palmar
description: Here we could fill our Diesel tank. Go to Office directly, owner is very helpful.

name: Diesel available
description: We were able to refill diesel here. They were super friendly and we did not have to wait in line.

name: PDVSA (diesel)
description: They have diesel for government vehicles, and if you ask nicely you can have some too ;-) We were allowed to fill up 100l at normal prices. There is gasoline too.

name: Grassy field in front of the ocean
description: Quiet place to spend the night. It's on a grassy field in front of the river and ocean. People in this fisherman village are friendly.

name: Peaje Tazon
description:
Parking near the toll. It is a safe and relatively quiet place to sleep if you want to avoid sleeping in Caracas. It is not pretty since it is an area where truckers sleep, there are restaurants and a police booth. We slept one night without problem. We asked permission from the police officer on duty who wanted us to collaborate. We didn't give him anything and we stayed the same. There is no bathroom except if you are going to order at a restaurant. only good for sleeping
______________________________

Parqueadero cerca del peaje. Es un sitio seguro y relativamente tranquilo para dormir si querés evitar dormir en Caracas. No es lindo ya que es una zona donde los camioneros duermen, hay restaurantes y una caseta policial. Dormimos una noche sin problema. Pedimos permiso al policía de guardia que quizo que le demos una colaboración. Nosotros no le dimos nada y nos quedamos igual. No hay baño exc si vas a pedir a algún restaurante. solo bueno para dormir

name: Estacion El Carmen
description:
Gasolina disponível 0,50 usd o litro 

$0,50 usd per liter gas

name: Beach Brake Bar & Restaurant
description: A very nice beach bar and restaurant surf oriented at the Playa Parguito on Margarita Island, one of the few options to wild camp, you can park at their parking and use the toilets, showers, etc. Ask for Maricarmen

name: Ferry Isla Margarita
description:
Here you can buy your ferry Ticket for you and your vehicle. We paid 314 $ for us 2 and our 6,70 Long Truck one way. Pretty expensive.
Be aware: the very unfriendly drug Police searched our car and asked for a collaboration without success

name: End of the road
description: This is the end of the road, so there it is a bit more quiet then the rest of the area. There are a few private piers with yachts, where you can stay in front of. Ask for permission at the friendly guards first! They get nervous when you approach the boats (they are guarding them), so probably best to stay of the piers unless you have permission. The surrounding area is probably very beautiful, but you can’t see much of it from the shore unless you take a boat ride.

name: Balneario Bocatoma
description:
Parking area with tables, palapas and grills to spend the day. It's nice, it's a shame it hasn't been maintained for a while. It is assumed that you can sleep there too, but several people recommended not staying. We didn't find it unsafe but the mosquitoes made us leave. It is next to the river which is very nice and cool.
There are no bathrooms or drinking water. There are some shops a few km away but it is advisable to buy everything you need for the day in the town before coming.
---
Sector de parking con mesas, palapas y asadores para pasar el día. Es lindo, lastima q no tiene mantenimiento hace rato. Se supone q se puede dormir también pero varios nos recomendaron no quedarnos. No nos pareció inseguro pero los mosquitos definieron el irnos. Está al lado del río que es muy lindo y fresquito.
No hay baños ni agua potable. A unos km hay algunas tiendas pero es recomendable comprar todo lo del día en el pueblo antes de venir.

name: Pedros place
description: Here we stayed with our Truck one day and night. Pedro runs the parking place and the rental chairs on the beach. The place itself is not very nice but its full of shadow the hole day. pedro is taking care of your car while you are on the dream beach ,'el aqua', laying under palm trees. He wanted nothing for our stay, we gave 10$. Average 4g Movistar signal

name: Church car park with a view
description: A small fairly flat space to park next to and old church. Quiet, just a few motos passing on the road and felt safe. Nice view :)

name: Basílica Menor Santuario
description: 20 bolivares to enter. You can park for the night next to the police post. A safe and quite place to park for the night. There are toilets inside the basilica. Police are friendly and there is shade under the trees. No cell reception

name: Fishermen (not recommended)
description:
Better not stay here!
We stayed one the private property of a Fisher. Price was 10$. when we paid next day they Just kept our 20$. Very progressive people.No Movistar signal. Not recommended

name: Playa Colorada
description: It's a parking lot at the end of playa colorada, next to the restautant "la negra martha".We slept two nights here, is quiet and the beach is really nice. The parking lot is free, but we ate lunch at the restaurant because they probably expect you to consume something there. (a plate with fish is around 10$). There is rubbish around on this end. The kids in the area are super curious about you and they will keep you company.

name: Quiet bay next to a hotel
description: We spent a few nights here. We parked next to the hotel, at night they have the security guard. Talked with the owner, very friendly, she also invited us to park in the fenced hotel parking lot. But we just stayed outside and it was fine too.

name: PDV San Tomé
description:
Gas avaiable $ 0,50 usd per liter.

gasolina disponível por $0,50 usd o litro

name: PDV Ciudad Bolivar
description:
Gas avaiable $0,50 usd per liter. 

gasolina disponível por $0,50 usd o litro.

name: Posada Bella Vista
description: nice clean basic posada with possibly the best view I've ever had from a hotel.  paid $25 per person per night for room with private bath but also includes dinner and breakfast.  moto parking available and wifi

name: Gas station
description: Was able to buy gas here for $0.5/liter, practically no lines.

name: Gas Station Tepuy
description: This seems to be the only gas station of the city working on Sundays. Don't accept credit cards, the line was quite short.

name: down by the river
description: ok stop for a night.  would be really nice except it's literally right off the road.  you are hidden so no one can see you but when trucks go over the bridge it's loud.  not much traffic though especially overnight when I was here on a Sat night.  it's a popular swim spot for locals so busy during the day but from sunset until 11am you'll have it to yourself.  also apparently this is where all the cow herders have their cows cross the river to graze so every few hours expect some guys on horses to walk 20 cows down next to you.  no phone signal for Movistar or digitel

name: Don Rafa
description:
Community of fishermen of the Orinoco River, here we eat the best fish in the whole country! I highly recommend it. Open from Thursday to Sunday from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. The best fish of Venezuela. Open Thusday to Sunday

-----------------------------------------------

Comunidade de pescadores do rio Orinoco, aqui comemos o melhor pescado de todo o país! super recomendo. Aberto de jueves a domingo das 8 as 16h

name: Boats to visit islands of Morrocoy
description: One of several places that boats to the islands leave from. Boats also leave from Chichiriviche. We went to Playauelita which was very nice, about 200m long beach with nice water, protected from waves by a reef, many trees and sun shades for rent. We paid $30 for 2 people. Others on our boat paid $40 for 4 and $50 for 4. So $10pp seems to be the correct price. Took around 20 minutes to fill the boat with 3 groups so it was full. We paid the guy, told him a time that we all wanted to be picked up and in the evening he arrived on time.

name: Diesel available here
description: here they have diesel. We came here twice: before and after the paria peninsula

name: Olas Café
description: Good coffee and a great panini. We asked where we could buy the amazing ciabatta bread that came with the panini and it comes from Valencia.

name: Hotel Nayarit
description: This hotel is two blocks from the entrance to Venezuela. A room with a double bed for two people cost us 35k COP. You can park on the street and it is very safe, but if you don't like that Right in front is a parking lot and the costs are 14k COP for 24 hours It's not the finest hotel but it's what you pay for. Downstairs a man sells delicious food and there are several markets less than a block away.

name: Dangerous Dip in road
description: When you come around this corner there is a couple of drainage channels at the bottom of the dip which is not obvious. Approach with caution as at any speed it will give you nasty jolt!

name: Salto Sakaika
description:
A very pretty spot with old infrastructure. Unfortunately the last 50m of track to the grass above cascades had a barricade so meant we wouldn’t be able to camp above and next to the water. Went to check out the other spot nearby.

Definitely has potential here

name: Boats to Isla Larga
description: Boats leave from here to Isla Larga (a perfect Carribbean beach) , probably every 15 minutes or so in the morning. $10pp return, non negotiable (Venezuelans on our boat paid the same). There is space to park your car here and some "guards" that will watch your car, we paid them $3. The boat trip is a bit iffy as you leave and enter this town as they have to go through big waves. Bring waterproof bag if you have camera etc. On Isla Larga there are shade structures, chairs and space to put a towel down under some trees. there is a restaurant that I would guess does seafood. On a Friday there was around 100 people on a stretch of beach 200m long, probably pretty crowded on the weekends. At the western end of the island you will see 2 shipwrecks, these are amazing to snorkel around. They look small and shallow and they start in about 70cm of water only metres from shore but they are actually huge, multi deck ships that extend to a depth of over 10m at the back. WARNING do not touch the ships at all, we accidentally brushed against the sealife growing on the wrecks and it stung like a jelly fish and left a rash. There is also some contamination in this area.  After grabbing at what looked like a plastic bag in the shallows i realised it was essentially solid oil. Soon after a national guard officer came running out of the bushes to tell us it's fine to snorkel at the wrecks, but don't touch anything due to the contamination with petroleum products. Around the area of the ship wreck you can see dozens of electric blue lizards

name: Supermarket and bakery
description: Small supermarket with bakery inside. Nothing fancy but they do good savoury bread and a few other savoury and sweet options. Good spot to grab some snacks if heading to Isla Larga or Patanemo

name: Station PDV
description: No problem here to fill up Diesel 60Liters/50cent

name: Hosteria Waipá
description:
Luis is the owner of Hosteria Waipá and is part of the support network for travelers here in Venezuela.  The place has an incredible structure, ample and secure parking, power point, drinking water, bathrooms, shower, swimming pool, laundry.  It is close to a supermarket, pharmacy and oil centers.  In addition to all the structure available, Luis is a motorcycle traveler and it was truly incredible to be able to share some moments with him and his family.  Please notify him in advance to find out if parking is available +58 416-6862497.  We spent incredible days here, I highly recommend it.
.....
Luis é o proprietário da Hosteria Waipá e faz parte da rede de apoio a viajantes aqui da Venezuela. O local tem uma estrutura incrível, estacionamento amplo e seguro, ponto de energia, água potável, banheiros, chuveiro, piscina, lavanderia. Fica próximo a supermercado, farmácia e lubricentros. Além de toda a estrutura disponível, Luis é motoviajeiro e foi realmente incrível poder compartilhar uns momentos com ele e sua família. Avise com antecedência para saber se há disponibilidade para estacionar +58 416-6862497. Passamos dias incríveis aqui, super recomendo. 
..

name: Playa Buchuaco
description:
Peaceful and safe, the night was silent. The place is on the edge of the beach, there are little straw tents all over the beach, including viewpoints about 2 meters high.

Beautiful sunset, the sunrise was at sea, incredibly fantastic!

At night we sat on the sand on the beach enjoying the stars that shine through the darkness of the region.

We recommend!


Quiet and safe, at night it was silent. The place is close to the beach, there are small shopping malls all over the beach, including viewpoints about 2 meters high.

Beautiful sunset, the dawn was on the sea, incredibly fantastic!

At night we sat in the arena on the beach enjoying the stars that shone in the darkness of the region.

We highly recommend it!
---
Tranquilo e seguro, a noite foi silenciosa. O local é na beira da praia, tem tendinhas de palha por toda praia, inclusive mirantes de uns 2 metros de altura. 

Lindo pôr do sol, o nascer do sol foi no mar, incrivelmente fantástico! 

A noite ficamos sentados na areia da praia curtindo as estrelas que realçam na escuridão da região. 

Recomendamos! 


Tranquila y segura, la noche era silenciosa. El lugar está cerca de la playa, hay pequeñas tiendas de paja por toda la playa, incluidos miradores de unos 2 metros de altura.

Hermosa puesta de sol, el amanecer estaba en el mar, ¡increíblemente fantástico!

Por la noche nos sentamos en la arena de la playa disfrutando de las estrellas que brillan en la oscuridad de la región.

¡Nosotros recomendamos!

name: Rio Supermarket
description:
The best supermarket in Venezuela, good prices, ample parking, bakery, restaurant, diverse product options, friendly staff and pet friendly.

O melhor supermercado da Venezuela, bons preços, estacionamento amplo, padaria, restaurante, diversas opções de produtos, funcionários simpáticos e pet friendly.

name: Bomberos
description: They let us park in their parking lot for the night. Nothing special, but was getting dark and there was not much around. The night was quiet.

name: Playa cristal
description:
Wild camping spot between fishermen Houses. Its a Mini Playa in front. Friendly people allowed us to stay overnight. Untill 5am very quiet, then they start to set Up fish nets....
Look Out for low hanging cables!

name: PDV Diesel and Gasolina
description: Here you can fill your tanks with Diesel o Gasolina. Buy first a Ticket (how many liters) and than get it for 50cent

name: PDV diesel
description: At the other side of the roundabout of the other filling station. The front is gasoline, the back is diesel. Two times now, they were not servicing the diesel pump, but when asked, they gave us as much diesel as we wanted at the normal price, but cash only.

name: Posada Palagar / Land Rover owner
description:
Simple posada run by a fantastic family. Big rooms and own kitchen for self catering upstairs. 

If you are a landy owner, Romulo is a fanatic and connected to the other landy owners in Venezuela.

Best to contact via WhatsApp before stopping +58 4147264336

name: AC specialists
description: AC specialists all brands. 60 dollars to change a valve that was leaking and refill the circuit with gas. Whatsapp +58 4246378661

name: Posada Turistica Dona Julia
description:
Excellent option to stop and rest for a few days before continuing your journey to or back from Gran Sabana.  Ample, flat parking, water and power point, bathroom, shower, swimming pool, wi-fi and restaurant with several options and excellent prices.  Seu Orlando is part of the support network for travelers here in Venezuela, contact us via WhatsApp before arriving to check availability +58 414 3860067. The place is very quiet, I highly recommend it.
_______________________________

Excelente opção para parar e descansar uns dias antes de seguir viagem para a Gran sabana ou na volta dela. Estacionamento amplo, plano, ponto de água e de energia, banheiro, chuveiro, piscina, wi-fi e restaurante com diversas opções e excelentes preços. Seu Orlando faz parte da rede de apoio a viajantes aqui na Venezuela, entre em contato pelo whatsapp antes de chegar para verificar disponibilidade +58 414 3860067. o local é muito tranquilo super recomendo.

name: Ruben km88
description:
Ruben has a motorcycle workshop at km88 and provides support to travelers.  Call in advance on Whatsapp +58416-9811617 to tell them which support you need, there is not space to park big RVs, but we did take safe overnight with our VW kombi, so it is important to arrange it in advance.  He and his family are very friendly, they help us with wi-fi, cold water and lots of information about Gran Sabana.

...

Ruben tem oficina de motos no km88 e dá suporte aos viajantes.  Ligue previamente no Whatsapp +58416-9811617 para dizer qual suporte você precisa, não há muito espaço para estacionar por isso é importante combinar com antecedência.  Ele e sua família são muito simpáticos, nos ajudaram com wi-fi, água gelada e muitas informações sobre Gran Sabana.
...

Ruben tiene un taller de moto en km88 y presta apoio a viajeiros. Llamar antes en Whatsapp +58416-9811617 para decir cual apoio necesita, no hay mucho espacio para parquear entonces és importante cordinar antes. El y su família son muy amables, nos ayudaran con wi-fi, agua fria y muchas informaciones del Gran Sabana.

name: Taller de Motos - Ruben Km 88
description:
Ruben has a motorcycle workshop at km88 and provides support to travelers.  Call in advance on Whatsapp +58416-9811617 to tell them which support you need, there is not space to park big RVs, but we did take safe overnight with our VW kombi, so it is important to arrange it in advance.  He and his family are very friendly, they help us with wi-fi, cold water and lots of information about Gran Sabana.

...
Ruben tem oficina de motos no km88 e dá suporte aos viajantes.  Ligue previamente no Whatsapp +58416-9811617 para dizer qual suporte você precisa, não há muito espaço para estacionar por isso é importante combinar com antecedência.  Ele e sua família são muito simpáticos, nos ajudaram com wi-fi, água gelada e muitas informações sobre Gran Sabana.
...

Ruben tiene un taller de moto en km88 y presta apoio a viajeiros. Llamar antes en Whatsapp +58416-9811617 para decir cual apoio necesita, no hay mucho espacio para parquear entonces és importante cordinar antes.
