name: Rio Supermercado
description: Large modern supermarket with very good variety of products. Probably the best we’ve seen in Venezuela after 5 months in the country. Many imported and local products, good choice of chocolate, nutella, cold meats, cheese, etc… great place to stock up before the gran sabana. Normal prices (for Venezuela)

name: Campearito
description: Here we stayed for the night in our Truck. Not super quiet but okay for overnight. We just asked the lady from the grill and one patron from the houses, all said okay and were super friendly. We bought a huge portion of pollo for 5$ from the grill, delicious. Place is free!

name: PDV Angel (diesel)
description: Only station with dollarized diesel in town. Big queue, but ask in the office and they will let travellers skip the queue. Regular prices. They seem to almost always have enough diesel and there are no limits to the amount (until 200liter)

name: San Onofre (diesel)
description: Your only option for diesel in Upata. Supply is very erratic. We filled up twice here, one time we had to wait three days. Limited quantities only, hesitant to give more then 40 liters. Best to fill up in puerto ordaz

name: campamento Mantopai
description: Indigenous managed camping place, good for rvs or tents, they also have cabins and restaurant but must be booked from Kavanayen, there is a stream in front of the Mantopai Tepui (India Acostada) there is a hike to get closer to the Tepui, offroad vehicle needed, many rock, sand and some step hills to get there (follow the arrows)

name: Salto Toron
description: Wild Camp by the Salto Toron, you need a good 4wd vehicle, you need to cross the Toroncito river, or just camp just there and walk, very nice waterfalls, not very much visited, no service at all, only nature

name: NO ferry
description: No ferry at this time! (February 2024)  We had to take a detour with more than 50km.

name: E/S Provisional km88
description: “Temporary” filling station straight from a lorry. They always say they don’t have any diesel, but twice we were able to get a little bit after insisting (politely!) (20liter). Can’t rely on diesel being available here, but you can try…

name: Purificadora
description: Here they refill your garrafone: 2 reais 20 lt

name: Poso Manakachí
description:
Camping familiar ao lado do rio, super tranquilo, banheiros, quiosques. Pagamento sem valor fixo, colaboração voluntária. 

Perfect spot to overnight, around river and beautiful viewpoint. Volunter paiment.

name: gas station
description: gas station large enough to spend the night with a motorhome.  After the movement of people coming to buy fuel ends, it becomes very calm.

name: FJ Cars Service
description:
EN General mechanics and car electrics.
José attended us wonderfully, we changed air and gas-oil filters.
Mobile: +584126417268
ES Mecánica general y electricidad del automóvil.
José nos atendió maravillas, cambiamos filtros de aire y gas-oil.
Móvil: +584126417268

name: On the Beach
description:
To camp on the beach very quiet and safe

-------------------------------------------

Para acampar en la playa muy tranquilo y seguro

name: CATTA Cafe
description: Very lovely Coffeeshop, with good wifi, and Espresso, parking infront Coffeeshop, quit Area

name: El Sol Posada
description: Good hotel option in a nice and safe neighborhood. We paid 30$ per night for an apartment with kitchen and king size bed. Safe parking and super friendly hosts Zaida & Fernando. They are connected with Christian, the best tour guide in Tájira. Restaurants and Supermarkets (Garzón & Baratta) plus good bakery nearby. Jardín Botanico close by. Recommended!

name: The Grand hotel galaxy
description:
Very basic hotel. 20$ a night with secure parking and near plaza bolivar.
I looked for a loooot of hotel here for me and my motorcycle but it is very hard to find something descent. There is no wifi, they are motel you pay for 3h or 12h daily… not really for tourism but hey… you have a place to stay. 
I would say Caracas is easy to drive in, very poor, the historic center is beautiful, but that’s it :/
Enjoy the most you can

name: NOT the road to Sakaika
description: Most gps mapping software indicate this as the entry road to Sakaika. This track is however only used by people on foot (and the occasional lost overlander ;-) ). Very tight watercrossing. Do not take this road! There is a perfectly good entrance road just south of this point, at the southern side of the bridge.

name: Chaplin Mechanic/ Coro
description: Chapulin, fix Motos, big one do! He fix my Suzuki Dr 650!! Perfect work!! He drive by himself BMW 1200, Suzuki Dragstar 1100

name: Hotel Cumarebo
description: The hotel looks like "Love hotel"! But in Google reviews it says that families liked it.! Anyway, the house is OK, parking for your motorbike directly below your room! Double bed 20 Dollars! Around is nothing else. Quiet, clean, good for 1 Night!

name: Centro Veterinario Ernisis
description:
This vet helped us a lot with our export papers. We entered Venezuela without papers and the INSAI wanted to see our import papers. The vet spoke to the persons at INSAI and after that it was no more a problem. Very friendly and competent vet. 
The health certificate costs around 100$, quite expensive. We asked at several different vets and the price was always like that or even higher.
It is a thorough check incl. a blood test.
The official health certificate from INSAI costs another 50$.

name: INSAI
description:
This is the INSAI office you will need to go to to get your export papers for your pet. They will help you setting up your online account. The process is not really straight forward but with their help it is kind of easy. Costs around 50$.
I'd recommend you going to the Veterinário Ernisis to get the Health Certificate. I have also put a pin on iOverlander for them. They also know the process for the export papers.

Keep in mind that INSAI wants to see your import papers from entering Venezuela. So do it properly at the border when entering Venezuela. We did not and only thanks to Ernisis we could get our export papers. It takes a few days until everything is in order, so plan ahead before exiting Venezuela. You get the status update in your online account. So if you have everything in order you only need to visit INSAI once. 

You will also have to go to the INSAI at the border to get your final documents for the export. We did not as there was total chaos at the border in La Guajira and the Colombian ICA at first didn't want to accept our papers.

We did not have any Infos about the procedure so I hope this helps you a little bit and prevents you from the mistakes we made.

(If you type in INSAI in Google Maps, it will show a different office. Don't go to that office. This Pin shows you the correct place.)

name: Movistar
description:
The movistar center where you can come and change plan (from $9 to $17 for 25gb for exemple).
Other small movistar shops are only to recharge

name: Salto Manakachi
description:
We passed by the Marakachi waterfall. It is 500 meters from the road and you can enter with any vehicle. The place is very nice and quiet, it has a bathroom and shower. There is also a barbecue. The place is in charge of an indigenous community that asks for a daily contribution. We left 20 reais to spend the night. As in all the great savannah, there are puripuri, which is a very small mosquito that bites you!
----
Pasamos por el salto de marakachi. Esta a 500 metros de la ruta y se puede entrar con cualquier vehiculo. El lugar es muy lindo y tranquilo, tiene baño, ducha. Hay asador tambien. El espacio esta a cargo de una comunidad indigena que te pide una colaboracion por dia. Nosotros le dejamos 20 reales para pasar la noche. 
como en toda la gran sabana hay puripuri, que es un mosquito muy pequeño que te pica!

name: Budowa camp- camping store
description:
Small (and only) camping store in Marracay.
many different Gaz bottle.
many different camping article.
fuel canister.

name: mercantil ATM
description: here we could withdraw everyday Bs400 with our MasterCard and 4 times Bs400 with our visa.

name: La posada
description: Very nice little place to stay to visit this incredible Pueblo. Very safe and there is a lot of place to eat.

name: Finca San Mateo
description:
EN Finca a San Mateo. This is the farm and mill where the liberator Simón Bolívar grew up.

ES Finca a San Mateo. Se trata de la finca e ingenio donde se crío el libertador Simón Bolívar.

name: Calle entre la universidad y el cuartel militar
description:
EN On the street between the university and the military barracks. At the toll we were told it was a very safe place.

ES En la calle entre la universidad y el cuartel militar. En el peaje nos dijeron era un lugar muy seguro.

name: Battery Express
description: Batterie Service for Cars, Trucks, and Motorbikes! Best Service very, very professional! Franky himself the owner is a Motorbike IOverlander too! He help you for other things if you need

name: Diesel Mercado Negro
description: here you can ask to the locals, they also have Diesel on sunday

name: GCPGARAGE
description: car mechanic garage , sell parts, welding

name: Up the hill
description: Great spot to overnight up on the hill, flat space on top. wonderful sundown/Sunset, a bit windy. for free

name: La Mediana quesería
description:
EN The best cheeses of the region. The most delicious and typical is the Guayamano cheese.
There is also meat on a stick.

ES Los mejores quesos de la región. Lo más rico y típico es el Queso Guayamano.
También hay carne en vara.

name: Hotel Imperio
description: Good Hotel, clean, Parking free, AC, cold Water, 1 Person 20 Dollar! Everything ok, área Good, bakery, shops near by 50 Meter

name: MOTO BRO-Suzuki-Kawa-Yamaha
description: Suzuki, Yamaha, Kawasaki...! Very professional, Yamaha Mechanic Zertifikat! All kind of tools, repairs big Motorbikes and small too!  Even Motorbike clothes, Oil, and Parts! I really recomend it!!

name: PDV Valencia
description: Big fuel station with multiple diesel pumps. Long line of trucks queuing but we could skip to the front. Paid normal $0,50 price (cash only). Looks like they get tankers refilling the tanks everyday

name: GNB Los Caracas
description:
We arrived on a weekday and there was no one at the campsite, the guards (GNB) gave us permission to spend the night stationed right in front of the checkpoint, they also lent us the bathroom and brought us potable water. 
Outdoor showers and the sea on one side. Good option to sleep super safe.

Llegamos en día de semana y no había nadie en el camping, los guardias (GNB) nos dieron permiso para pasar la noche estacionados justo al frente del puesto de control, también nos prestaron el baño y nos cargaron agua potable.
Duchas al aire libre y el mar de un lado.
Buena opción para dormir super seguros.

name: Estacionamiento Chuspa
description:
Quiet parking to spend the night, the town is very safe and the people are very friendly. From here the boats leave for Playa Caribe, Playa el Indio and others.
They have affordable prices and the beaches are beautiful.
They charge $2 for parking
There are outdoor beach showers.
Estacionamiento tranquilo para pasar la noche, el pueblo es muy seguro y la gente muy amable. De acá salen las lanchas para Playa Caribe, Playa el Indio y otras más. 
Tienen precios accesibles y las playas son hermosas.
Cobran 2$ por estacionar
Hay duchas de playa al aire libre.

name: Hotel Playa Colada
description: Beautiful great hotel, very clean, big rooms, great swimming pool, breakfast possible, Dinner possible! All Rooms with AC! Directly on Beach, very calm!! 25 Dollar  Room, or 30 Dollar including breakfast.

name: Ferevidrios boyaca
description:
Translation: We are crossing to the end of the world, they welcomed us here, very friendly people welcome travelers, the contact number is +584143712576 with Carlos
Contact before arriving at the destination, it has hot water showers and a very safe place to stop and get to Maracaibo

Somos travesía al fin del mundo nos recibieron aquí, Gente muy amable reciben viajeros el número de contacto es +584143712576 con Carlos 
Contactar antes de llegar al destino, tiene duchas agua caliente y un lugar muy seguro para parar y llegar a Maracaibo

name: Posada Lá Pastora Beach
description:
Very nice posada, salt water pool, friendliest owners!! Unfortunately everything was full! Would stay here longer, room with AC!! Price 45 dollars double room! Can only recommend this, right on the beach!
Sehr schöne Posada, Salzwasser Pool, freundlichste Inhaber!! Leider war alles voll! Würde hier länger bleiben, Zimmer mit AC!! Preis 45 Dollar Doppelzimmer! Kann dies nur empfehlen, direkt am Strand!

name: salto Kawi Meru
description: Very beautiful waterfall with plenty of water to swim. Easy access just 200m walking. You leave the car in the entrance where one family leaves. Possible to pass the night here

name: Posada "Casablanca"
description: Very nice Hotel, beautiful clean, big Pool, it's possible to park 2 Motorbike, Good Food, best Fish 10 Dollars, Laundry Service... Double room 40 Dollar for 2 Persons, I paid 20 Dollar!! Very Quit!! Beautiful Beach 5 Minutes to away!!

name: gas station

Highest road point in Venezuela.

Swallow Camp.

.....
Campamento la golondrina.

description:
Parque de la bandera en el Tigre, managed by the mayor's office. Place of obligatory passage of the travelers from or to La Gran Savana, the mayor's office enables a space for the travelers. 
Contact Andrés +584249024041

Parque de la bandera en el Tigre, manejado por la alcaldía. Lugar de paso obligado desde o hacia La gran Savana, la alcaldía habilita un espacio para los viajeros.

name: Outdoor Colombia
description: camping store at large mall that sell the small butane/propane gas for camping stoves.  also has hammocks and tons of other camping gear if needed

name: Diesel: Merida
description: After not finding diesel at any of the government run stations in town we stopped here. You pay a premium (USD0.95) but they claim to have diesel 90% of the time. They have their own tankers.  The guard at the entrance will tell you you need to be on a list but ask at the office and they will probably help.

name: Distribuidora Apocalipsis
description: All Parts, for Motorbike, and Cars tires, tube, Oil, lights...

name: E/S Serv express Roraima
description:
EN 
They support travelers, we get diesel here, and they usually have them every day of the week. It is important to ask the attendant if you can load before queuing as they are usually long. We did and they gave us priority without waiting.
---------
ES E/S SERV EXPRESS RORAIMA apoyan a los viajeros, conseguimos diésel. Normalmente tienen todos los días de la semana. Es importante preguntar al  encargado si puedes cargar antes de hacer la cola que suelen ser largas. Nosotros lo hicimos y nos dieron prioridad sin esperar.

name: SAIME Visa Extension
description:
Here you can extend your Visa for 90 days. Here's a few things you need to know:
There is gonna be a huge queue, so come as early as possible. They won't let you in the queue after 10 AM. Dress appropriately: No shorts or flip flop. Wear long pants, shoes and t-shirt: take it serious, they are strict about it. Documents you need:
-Your Passaport
-A copy of the front page of your passport
-A copy of Venezuelan entry stamp
-A written letter with the reason why you want to extend your stay
-If you are travelling without vehicle, you need an exiting flight ticket
-if you are travelling with a vehicle, you need a copy of the document of the vehicle, and a copy of your license.
You must pay ONLY by Card, they won't accept cash.
The price is 60$ p/p.
You are also not allowed to use phone inside the office, if they see you using it, they might kick you out.
The whole process took us around 2 hours. The longest part is the queue, because once you are there, it only takes 30 minutes.
Just be patient, relax and enjoy Venezuela.

name: Posada San Francisco
description: Nice enough hotel with clean rooms and a  large parking area.  paid $20 USD for a matrimonial room for 2 people.  AC, wifi and tiny old tv.  similar prices all around this area but this one has parking.  good enough for the night before we go to Isla margarita tomorrow

name: Vehicle Permit Extension
description:
Here you can extend your vehicle permit for 90 extra days. The process takes more days (at least for us). Come here the first time so day can send all your documents to the chief of the aduana. He is the one who is gonna grant and extension (you can also make a letter to explain the reason why you are extending it). After a few days they will contact you with and tell you to come over again and get the stamp on the passport and also the copy of the new permit. (they might also check the vehicle to see if everything is as described on the paper). Everything is free. You only need to remember that there is a dress code as at SAIME. Long pants and shoes.
They are very friendly and will try to help you as much as they can. We suggest you to get their phone number (whatsapp as well) so you can ask them for any update during the process.

name: Posada Villa Caribee
description:
really nice place with super friendly Colombian owner.  small basic apartments but they have everything you need and are clean and comfortable.  paid US$20 for an apartment for 2 people, with bedroom, small living room/kitchen with 4 burner stove and fridge, private bath and balcony overlooking the nice small pool.  peaceful quiet place with covered parking for Motos and bikes, may be able to fit another small car as well but tall vehicles would have to be parked on street.  found on Airbnb but got for pretty much half price by whatsapping him an booking directly.  highly recommend.  he has 3 small dogs.  he took us out on the town one night as well and is also a great cook, with fresh seafood meals available if you book in advance from $7-$9
owner Vladimir: +58 412-0941041

name: Casa de reyna
description:
Translation: Parking for travelers in motorhomes, campers and motorhomes with wifi. Bathroom with shower and mechanical service. Just 20 km from Maracay.

Parking para viajeros en motorhome .campers y autocaravanas con wifi. Baño con ducha y servicio de mecanica. A solo 20 km de maracay.

name: Jardin Botanico Maracaibo
description: This is the place TO BE for overlanders If you are in Maracaibo! We stayed inside the garden for 2 nights before we crossed the border to Columbia. We paid 4$ for 2 nights. Many shady areas, a great playground for Kids, very secure and a small resto with basic food and drinks. also wifi and toilets. staff is incredible friendly and helpful

name: migracion
description: Venezuela - Col: Here you stamp Out Venezuela from your Passport. took us 5 minutes

name: Playa Los Angeles
description:
$1 entrance for the beach parking

There are a couple of big trees that you can park under to be in the shade during the day. 

There are bathrooms and an outdoor shower (a pipe) that you can use

There is also a tap next to the bathrooms to fill your tanks

All the water is clean and drinkable it comes from the mountain

People are super friendly and it felt safe to me 

There is some noise from the road 

It was quite empty when I was there in the week just a couple of families coming to the beach in the day but I think it will be busy on the weekends

name: Hotel Terraza Suite
description: Very very clean, safe inside Parking! Rooms from 30-55 Dollar! Restaurant 150 Meter across street very nice, look like italian Highwayrestaurant has everything fresh, hot meal abd perfect Espresso!

name: Muelle de Punta de Piedra
description:
Ferry from PDP to Isla de Coche 5$ per person, the bicycle does not pay. we left on Friday 08hs and returned on Sunday 15.30hs. you can go and return in the day. if you do not travel by vehicle or bicycle I recommend you to take the boat that leaves from "La Isleta" cheaper and faster.
---
Ferry de PDP a Isla de Coche 5$ por persona, la bicicleta no paga. 
Salimos el viernes 08hs y volvimos el domingo 15.30hs. podés ir y volver en el día.
si no viajas en vehículo o bicicleta te recomiendo tomar la lancha que sale de "La Isleta" más económica y rápida

name: fuel
description: 3 fuel stations in a row, all open, no line.  most gas I've seen in one place since entering Venezuela 2 months ago.

name: Hotel Doña Romelia
description: I stayed here on my way to the Gran Sabana. Clean room and bathroom. Air conditioning. Safe parking for my motorcycle. Shopping within walking distance. I paid $15. Recommended.

name: Río Guayabal
description:
Beautiful place to spend the night next to the river in El Guayabal, quiet and safe town.
Don't recommend visiting this place in high season because it will be a lot of people.
----
Hermoso lugar para acampar al lado del rio El Guayabal, al lado de un pueblo tranquilo y seguro.
No recomendado en temporada alta porque llega mucha gente en el dia.

name: Laguna de Mucubaji National Park
description: Beautiful national park in the mountains.  Cost $1.50 for entrance per vehicle.  You enter to a large Laguna with your vehicle and can just hang around there or has several hikes you can do ranging from 2 km each way to much longer high elevation hikes that you need to do with a guide.  Can also pay for mules to take you on the hikes.  I will add photo of prices for mules.  I hiked to Quebrada La Negra (3.2 km each way) and took me about 3 hours at a casual pace.  highly recommend this hike through a high elevation pine forest and then down to a small laguna.  There is also a bathroom and cafe at entrance to the park.

name: Cueva del Guacharo
description: Largest cave in Venezuela.  Only can enter on guided tours.  costs $2.50 for locals and $5 for foreigners althought I don't think they get many foreigners because they charged us the local price.  We gave the other $5 as a tip to the guide.  2 hour tour goes 1.2 km into the cave, total cave is more than 10 km deep.  cool cave and definitely worth it.  can also come back at 6:30 pm to watch all of the birds leave the cave.  also some other waterfalls and hike a available at this national park

name: Cabañas Virgen del Valle
description: nice mini resort type hotel.  we paid US$20 for a clean room with comfortable bed and fam for 2 people.  they also have cabañas with kitchens and living rooms.for US$40 per person.  best part is the swimming pool and a nice bbq area where we brought our camping stove to cook dinner at night.  Only annoying thing is wifi pretty much only works in the reception, not in rooms and the cell service is hit or miss as well with both Digi and Movistar.  secure gated parking for my moto and just about any size rig.  we were the only guests here for 3 days.

name: Checkpoint Guardia Territorial
description:
here we needed to get out with the passports and they wrote our informations down.

indegenious checkpoint.

name: Doña Encarnación Restaurant
description:
Excellent place by the sea, with parking, power, water, toilets and a nice restaurant. Eloina the owner of the restaurant welcomes you with an open heart. We had two quiet nights, no noise, no mosquitoes. Phone signal works 4G.
----
Excelente sitio junto al mar, con estacionamiento, energía, agua, baños y rico restaurante. Eloina la dueña del restaurante los recibe con el corazón abierto.
Estuvimos dos noches tranquilas, sin ruido, sin mosquitos. Señal de teléfono funciona 4G.

name: Julio thundercats VW mechanic
description:
We went to Julio's workshop on the recommendation of a friend from the VW group in Venezuela. Julio treated us with great kindness and above all was very professional with our kombi. he helped us with maintenance and to solve a couple of problems that we had not solved for some time like getting a mirror or sealing our gas tank cap. i highly recommend him for his professionalism and kindness. Our experience was unbeatable. We recommend calling him first.
---
Fuimos al taller de Julio por recomendación de un amigo del grupo VW de Venezuela. no pudo ser mejor recomendación. Julio nos trató con mucha amabilidad y sobre todo fue muy profesional con nuestra kombi. nos ayudó a dar mantenimiento y a resolver un par de problemas que llevábamos tiempo sin resolver como conseguir un retrovisor o sellar la tapa de nuestro deposito de gasolina. lo recomiendo mucho por su profesionalidad y amabilidad. Nuestra experiencia fue inmejorable. Recomendamos llamarle primero.

name: Estacionamiento frente a Mi Kabrita
description:
100m from the road there is a large parking lot, in front of the local Mi Kabrita whose owner was very friendly with travelers. We slept here 4 nights without problem, quiet place except for Friday or Saturday where there can be loud music during the night.

A 100m de la ruta hay un estacionamiento grande, frente al Local Mi Kabrita cuyo dueño se mostró muy amistoso con los viajeros. Dormimos aquí 4 noches sin problema, lugar tranquilo a excepción del viernes o sábado donde puede haber música alta durante la noche.

name: Wifi libre FARMATODO
description:
Farmatodo has free wifi to connect
--
Farmatodo tiene wifi libre para conectarte

name: Gran Cacique II
description:
Here we booked the ferry to Isla Magarita with our Defender. 160USD one way for a 4h sail.
Come here 3 hours before departue and buy your tickets.
The ferry leaves every morning at 10am.
You can also buy the return ticket, the ferry from the Isla to here leaves at 6pm.
Staying overnight on the parking lot is possible and guarded.

name: Hotel La Sultana
description: $25 a night, secure big parking insight locked gate at night, park right outside your room, nice room w AC, hot water, mini fridge, and a desk. Not too much in the area but good dog just to spend the night

name: Nuevo Hotel Coromoto
description: Didn’t stay here but checked it out, $40 for cheapest room without breakfast, then the prices go up from there for bigger rooms and breakfast. Has spacious parking in front of hotel whose gate probably locks at night. There’s a pool and it does seem new!

name: Parking Plaza Las Heroinas
description: We stayed here for two nights. We announced ourselves at the police station next to the parking lot. And the Anastasia hotel also has private security. The people who work next to the parking are really nice. The hotel administration offered us wi-fi, bathrooms, showers with hot water and they have a water tap at the entrance

name: Purificador
description:
We found a purificador here on the corner.

30Bvs for 25 Liters.

name: El Tumbalele
description:
Here you have a huge food stall with a lot of different restaurants and also simple little "streetfood" stands.

Huge parking lot around.

name: Cheap food
description:
3 empanadas + salsa 1$
(pescado, pollo, carne mechada, papas y queso)
Really tasty and cheap empanadas.

name: Kitebeach
description:
Huge parking area direct at the Kitesurf beach. Restaurants and beach bars around. No facilities except in the restaurants/bars (showers and toilets).

Nice and breezy.

name: FARMATODO II
description:
Pharmacy open 24/7

Farmacia y tienda de conveniencia, abierto las 24 horas

name: Hotel Broadway

name: Andrea suite
description: Nice basic hotel with safe parking hot water and okish wifi usd12.

name: Next to Mi Kabrita Molino Rojo
description: This is one of the only plans places we find in the mountains. The place is large and spacious and is close to a place called Mi Kabrita ... It's worth meeting Cologne Tovar and this place is great for the motorhome to spend the night.

name: Diesel available here
description: We came here twice and they had diesel both times without queue. 0.5$ liter

name: Robo
description:
They stole our cell phone while parked on that corner. A man approached the driver's window and threatened him with the alleged possession of a firearm to take money or his cell phone.
----
Nos robaron el celular parqueados en esa esquina. Se acercó un hombre a la ventanilla del conductor y amenazó a mí pareja (que estaba solo esperando que volviera del supermercado) con la supuesta tenencia de un arma de fuego para llevarse dinero o el celular.

name: Farmatodo
description:
Pasamos Dos noches aquí mientras resolvíamos la prórroga del visado de nuestra kombi. Hay personal las 24h y cámaras. Es plano y nos prestaron el baño.

We spent two nights while solving the visa extensión for our kombi. Vigilance 24h and cameras in the parking. The parking lots are even and they let us use toilets.

name: playa de San Juan de los Cayos
description:
It is a very welcoming town, we were treated very well and the place feels very safe.
We camped on the beach, very quiet night. at this point there are several trees where we hung our hammocks.
The neighbors offered us water.
-------------
es un pueblo muy acogedor, nos trataron súper bien y se siente súper seguro el lugar.
acampamos en la playa, noche muy tranquila. en este punto hay varios árboles donde colgamos nuestras hamacas.
los vecinos nos ofrecieron agua.

name: Churuguara
description: Parking space right in the city, right next to the church. We were here on a Thursday and it was quiet at night. We felt safe.

name: Sertrica C.A.
description:
A capable mechanic. Offers fair price. 
Manager speaks a little English but certainly not enough to explain a problem. So either in Spanish or via translate. 

They are not “the listen to your problem” type but they understand what they see under the hood. The mechanics do anyway. The manager not so much. 

They claim to be leaders in injection and other things (picture) but seem to be an everything a bit type of mechanic. 

We stayed with the car the entire time to make sure to tell them what’s the problem and to prevent them doing things on their own. Do this because they do have a mind of their own. 

Our problem was a faulty intercooler. They couldn’t replace it with a new one since they don’t have this here. The welded the leak and cleaned it entirely in and outside. 

They have only a basic scanner, no brand so don’t expect too much. This can read and delete errors but many errors didn’t show that we knew existed. 

Height maximum for entrance is around 3m a wild guess. See picture.

So if you find yourself here in Barinas this is a reliable option.

name: Pozo los zorros. Parque nazional aguaro-guariquito
description: Pozos cristalinos de manantial dentro del parque nacional aguaro guariquito - estado guarico.  Buen sitio para camping. Acceso en vehiculos o campers 4x4

name: Sede Digitel
description:
We were able to buy a Digitel chip that cost 10 USD and we charged a 12G plan for 12 USD per month, which we have to unsubscribe upon leaving or it is unsubscribed only if one stops paying, because it is prepaid.

They only asked us for a passport and we were able to pay with a card. (They only accept cards or bolivars)

Pudimos comprar un chip Digitel que costó 10 USD y le cargamos un plan de 12G por 12 USD mensual, que tenemos que dar de baja al salir o se da de baja solo si uno deja de pagar, porque es prepago.

Solo nos pidieron pasaporte y pudimos pagar con tarjeta. (Solo aceptan tarjeta o bolívares)
.

name: Police checkpoint (corrupt)
description:
This is not the exact checkpoint. It’s 200 meters back to Tinaco. Small checkpoint with 4 police guys. Got stopped and after checking the papers he asked for another insurance paper which we should have which is valid per region? Really didn’t understand what he needed. We have the right insurance and all the import papers for our vehicle. 

My boyfriend needed to get out of the car and in front of our camper (where no one of his colleagues could see him) After a while he insisted 30 times that he would let us through and would arrange this paper for us if we payed him. We kind of acted like we didn’t understand the problem. Told him we just want to visit this beautiful country with kind people. After a while he said we could pass. 

Didn’t feel right at all. Felt like a extremely corrupt police officer.

name: Apoyo con Agua
description:
support with water, wifi and bathroom.

Apoyo con Agua, wifi y baño.

name: Support with water, wifi and bathroom.
description:
Support with Water, Wi-Fi, bathroom and with any information regarding the city or that is within reach. 

support with water, wifi and bathroom.

name: Hotel Las Truchas
description: Really nice hotel, with rooms and Cabañas.  It's really more of a resort than a hotel with a  basketball/football court, restaurant and outdoor grilling area.  official listed prices are $25 for a matrimonial room, $30 for a large cabana without kitchen or $35 with kitchen.  she gave us the matrimonial room for $20 though.  all rooms have outdoor areas with seating and amazing mountain views.  fast wifi, parking for any size vehicle and a garage they will let you park your moto in to keep it indoors if you prefer and free potable water and hot showers. highly recommend, we thought it was going to be way more expensive than it is by looking at it.

name: ApartaHotel RIOS
description: nice and clean small apartments for rent.  everything is in good condition and western standards.  I'm guessing they are normally used for long term people working in the oil industry.  We paid $30 for 2 people, online it was listed as $35 so probably worth just showing up.  nothing much going on in the town, it's just an oil town but we were making our way South to the mountains and didn't want to stop in Maracaibo so early.  No electricity generator and constant blackouts in the city though, we had power all night but lost power around 7am and didn't come back by the time we left at noon.  if youre in the area it's a little expensive but all we could find.

name: Agua
description:
There is a tap and we were able to connect the hose to fill the tank.

Hay una canilla y pudimos conectar la manguera para llenar el tanque. .

name: Club Naval Playa La Rosa
description:
Club Naval area of Playa La Rosa; we pay 
U$ 6.00 per vehicle and enjoyed the infrastructure of the Caribbean beach, (limited stay until 16:00). We asked for permission to stay overnight and they sent us to a protected and guarded area where we had a peaceful night's sleep with stunning views.
---------
Área do Club Naval da Playa La Rosa; pagamos 
U$ 6,00 por veículo e usufruímos da infraestrutura da praia caribenha, (permanência limitada até as 16:00 horas ). Solicitamos permissão para pernoitarmos e nos enviaram para uma área protegida e com vigilância onde tivemos uma noite de sono tranquila com uma paisagem deslumbrante.

name: At the plaza
description:
We slept a few blocks from this place, but you can spend the night wherever you want. The neighbors are very friendly, they share their Wi-Fi password with you, they give you drinking water. Here you can load water into your motorhome's tank.
Very nice colonial town!

Dormimos a unas cuadras de este lugar, pero puede pernoctar donde desees. Los vecinos son muy amables, te comparten su clave de wifi, dan agua potable. Aquí puedes cargar agua al tanque de tu motorhome. 
Muy lindo pueblo colonial !

name: Arepas Salas
description:
We were recommended to go to this place to try the best arepas in Mérida and it was incredible.  The arepa costs 2.7 USD and they are abundant.  Highly recommended
--
Nos recomendaron ir a este lugar a probar las mejores arepas de Mérida y fue increíble. vale 2.7 usd la arepa y son abundantes. Muy recomendado

name: PDV con diesel
description:
We can fill our tank with diesel. 0.50 usd per liter and can pay with card
-------
Pudimos llenar el tanque con diesel sin hacer fila a 0.50 usd el litro y pudimos pagar con tarjeta.

name: Kolsch o las cabañas de Alejandra
description:
Place to spend the night in room 10 pp, they have a kitchen and bathroom!

We parked in your parking lot and made use of the barbecue and Wi-Fi.

Very friendly people, we collaborate in buying gluten-free products that they offer there! (The cookies a delight)

name: la madurera bike camp
description: is a mountain camp to have a great natural experience

name: Orinoco Queen Lodge
description: A 2-hour boat tour takes you to Orinoco Queen Lodge. It is located in the middle of the jungle and has 9 small huts. All cabins have their own toilet and shower. Good WiFi is available. The people here are happy about every guest and are very happy. Various excursions are offered and you can also visit a village of the indigenous population ( Warao ). We stayed 4 days and enjoyed the time very much. For an appointment, please call or send a WhatsApp. ×584242347220

name: darle la vuelta | playa dorada parking
description:
Quiet and safe place!
We spent a night in the parking lot of the mall. It doesn't have any service. A few meters from the historic center of the choir sail.

Lugar tranquilo y seguro!
Pasamos una noche en el estacionamiento del centro comercial. No tiene ningun servicio. A pocos metros del casco histórico de la vela de coro.

name: UCV in front of Economato
description: Parking in front of Economato, we stayed here for three nights. Safe with security 24hrs. You can colaborate with them. They Give us Wifi .

We buy 20L potable water for $15bs

name: Aqua Vi Marina Hotel
description: Didn’t stay here but stopped to check it out. $60 for the cheapest room, it’s a large place with a big pool and large secure parking with security. Could be an option if you wanted a nicer place to stay. Hotel Puerto La Cruz down the way was $90 so this was at least a better deal

name: Potable water tapes
description:
Passando o pedágio, pela rodovia de Morón indo para Caracas, tivemos que dar a ré! Muitos nativos enchendo galões de água, nos falaram que é potável, tem umas 10 torneiras! Conseguimos encher a caixa 

There are a lot of potable water tapes! Free.After the toll-peaje, Next to the highway,  Troncal 1

name: Estacionamiento Playa Colorada
description:
Pasamos 1 noche en el estacionamiento principal de Playa Colorada.

Al llegar 2 chicos muy amables nos ofrecieron pescado y sillas y toldo, y nos dijeron que el estacionamiento era gratis. Luego un tercer chico vino a decirnos que teníamos que pagar una entrada, se puso insistente y como le dijimos que sabíamos que no teníamos que pagar nos pidió plata y se quedó sentado al lado de la camioneta. Fue raro e incómodo.

Para pasar la noche hablamos en el puesto de Guardia Bolivariana y nos dijeron que era seguro, que si igualmente no nos sentíamos cómodos podíamos ir a dormir a la alcabala y que si volvía a pasarnos una situación como la del chico, le avisaramos directamente a ellos.

La noche fue tranquila y en la licoreria de la ruta alquilan wifi 1 hs 10 bs. Supuestamente hay señal de Movistar y Movilnet, pero no nos funcionó ninguno de los 2

name: Parking  - Estacionamento Centro Valores
description:
Estacionamos para sair conhecer o centro. Pagamos 1 dolar e 10 bolivares. Há limite de altura (penso que até 2,5m) e não é permitido dormir dentro.

We parked here to go out and explore  the center of Caracas. We paied 1 dollar+10 bs. Height limit  (maybe 2,5 metros). Not allow to sleep.
